description: Last week at the DealBook Summit, I interviewed some of the worlds most influential leaders, among them Janet Yellen, the Treasury secretary of the United States; President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine; Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Meta; and Andy Jassy, the chief executive of Amazon.

title: The Risks of Yes, and Leadership
description: The rules of improv comedy are straightforward: Say Yes, and. Performers are instructed to accept every new idea introduced onstage  Youre wearing a fedora! or, Were in New Jersey!  and embrace a sense of utter uncertainty about where the act might be headed.

title: Theres a Lot of Entertainment Content. Where Do Profits Come From?
description: The entertainment industry is awash in content. That much was agreed on. Whether that content amounted to a golden age of creation or an age of gilded excess, where a focus on quantity has hurt quality, was hotly debated by a task force of entertainment industry executives convened by The New York Times at the DealBook Summit in New York last month.

title: In China, Luxury Shopping Faces Ongoing Headwinds
description: Toward the end of 2021, a glittering luxury shopping center called Taikoo Li Qiantan opened its doors in Shanghai. The 120,000-square-meter center (the equivalent to a stretch of 17 soccer pitches) is made up of nine buildings, landscaped gardens and stores from Western brands such as Balenciaga, Bulgari, Cartier, Gucci, Herms and Tiffany & Company. The expectation for this colossal state-of-the-art mall in Chinas commercial capital, owned by the Hong Kong conglomerate Swire Properties and the Lujiazui Group, was that it would soon attract hordes of shoppers who were eager to snap up luxury wares.

title: Can Fashion Be Profitable Without Growth?
description: Producing too many clothes is no longer a good look. That was the conclusion of a task force of fashion industry forces who gathered last week at the DealBook Summit in New York City.

title: From the DealBook Summit: Leaders Look Into the Future
description: For last weeks DealBook conference in New York City, The New York Times invited leaders in an array of disciplines to gather together to talk about some of the most pressing challenges they see as they look to the future in their areas of expertise. We asked them similar questions in advance. Their answers, which have been edited and condensed, are included here.

title: Balancing
description: What do you think this illustration is saying? How does it relate to or comment on society or current events? Can you relate to it personally? What is your opinion of its message?

title: What Makes a Great Gift?
description: What are you giving this holiday season? What are you hoping to get, or what have you already received?

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | U.S. Temperature Trends
description: Ten-day temperature trend graphs for 22 U.S. cities, similar to the graphs above, are published every Sunday in the national print edition of The New York Times. The graphs above are for Dec. 6 - 15.

title: Day 8: Listen to Mark Ronsons Funky Holiday Playlist
description: No other month has a soundtrack like Decembers. And while we love the holiday classics, we also love discovering festive songs and covers we havent heard 10 million times before.

title: Away From the Spotlight, a Debate Rages Over a Postwar Ukraine Economy
description: With Russian missiles pounding apartment buildings, power plants, schools and roads, a glimmering vision of a reconstructed postwar Ukraine seems impossibly far off. But an urgent battle of ideas has already begun over how to manage what would be the most extensive rebuilding project in Europe since the end of World War II.

title: A Gray Area of Loyalties Splinters a Liberated Ukrainian Town
description: SVIATOHIRSK, Ukraine  When Myroslava, a 36-year-old construction manager, returned to her hometown of Sviatohirsk in eastern Ukraine last month, she expected to find her house destroyed by shelling.

title: Weed Connoisseurs Celebrate Local Craft Growers
description: Good morning. Its Thursday. Well look at competitive marijuana growing and how it figures into the new retail marijuana industry in New York. Well also see why an accuser says the state attorney general, Letitia James, protected a top aide from fallout over sexual harassment allegations.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: A nationwide far-right terrorist network in Germany planned to storm the German Parliament, detain lawmakers and execute the chancellor, according to German prosecutors and intelligence officials. Thousands of police officers and special forces personnel fanned out across the country yesterday to raid 150 homes and arrest 25 suspected co-conspirators.

title: Britain Is Miserable, but Britons Are Fighting Back
description: LONDON  Britain is languishing, and the signs are everywhere.

title: In India, Fiercely Loyal Soccer Fans (of Brazil and Argentina)
description: Like a phoenix, the 30-foot-tall foam-board cutout of the soccer star Lionel Messi rises from a river running through lush green hills in the southern Indian state of Kerala, a towering symbol of a World Cup mania that knows no boundaries.

title: Late Night Celebrates Raphael Warnocks Win in the Georgia Runoff
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: THURSDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Striving to Make Netflixs Harry and Meghan Series Personal and Raw
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: My Practice: Retelling Rituals
description: The big center crop is known as makua, Mikiala Puaa-Freitas, the owner of a taro farm in Hawaii, told me. Makua is a term for parent in Hawaiian culture. All the offshoots, those are called keikis, and, you know, were all offshoots of our parents, she said.

title: Deion Sanders Leaving Jackson State Is No Surprise in the Coaching World
description: Deion Sanders is doing what virtually every college football coach in America would do if given a chance: He is leaving success at a smaller school with limited options for the promised land of better facilities, better support, a deeper bench of more talented players and a chance to play on a bigger stage.

title: A Long Road to Renewal for Former Military Bases
description: It is rare to come across hundreds of acres of land for sale in New Jersey, the countrys most densely populated state. But in Monmouth County, about 50 miles south of New York City, two expansive sites have sat largely undeveloped for years.

title: A Surge in Tourists in Restive Kashmir, but No Mental Peace for Residents
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  They come for the biggest tulip garden on the continent. They come for the snow-capped Himalayas. They come for the lakes. They come for the natural beauty that over time has enchanted Hindu kings, Mughal emperors, British colonialists and millions of regular people.

title: U.S. Gas Prices Are Now Lower Than a Year Ago
description: After months in which gasoline prices in the United States have been one of the most visible symbols of inflation, they have a new distinction: Prices at the pump are now lower than they were a year ago.The reversal of the price escalation that accompanied Russias invasion of Ukraine will ease pressure on American consumers dealing with the high cost of other essentials.

title: Drama, in German, in the Shadow of Leopoldstadt
description: MUNICH  My grandfather wore a caftan, my father went to the opera in a top hat, and I have the singers to dinner, boasts a character in Tom Stoppards Leopoldstadt, summing up the rapid trajectory from piety to cultural assimilation that was common among Viennas Jews in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: What We Learned From Harry and Meghan, Part One
description: Read the takeaways from part two of the series.

title: 36 Hours in Wellington, New Zealand
description: New Zealands pint-size and vertiginous capital has spectacular views, excellent dining and a one-of-a-kind bird sanctuary.

title: Judge John Hodgman on the Most Cheeky Onomatopoeia
description: Jordan writes: Is fart an onomatopoeia? My partner, Sav, says it doesnt evoke any sound. I think its just as good an approximation as toot, which we agree is an onomatopoeia. Who is right?

title: Poem: Advent
description: When I think of Nebraska poems, I mostly think of Ted Kooser and So This Is Nebraska, which celebrates the slow vastness of the state with an assertive universal and personal you. This poem by Kwame Dawes, however, aptly describes the way an outsider beyond Koosers all-encompassing you might feel in a state with a preserved culture of restraint and decorum unfamiliar to the speaker. Dawess speaker feels invisible and asynchronous: they cannot see/the despair in my eyes. By the end, the speaker has loosened decorum and commands someone, anyone, to Look/at my eyes. Pay attention, as if ordering the speaker himself to remember he is alive, visible and real in an infinite and unfamiliar land. Selected by Victoria Chang

title: Turnout by Republicans Was Great. Its Just That Many of Them Didnt Vote for Republicans.
description: After yet another disappointing showing for Republicans in Georgias Senate runoff on Tuesday, some conservatives  like Sean Hannity, Newt Gingrich and Kevin McCarthy  have begun to point to a surprising culprit: a failure to take advantage of early voting.

title: In Atlanta, Seeking a House With Ample Space Indoors and Out. Which Option Did He Choose?
description: With about $600,000 to spend, a first-time buyer searched for a house with a lot of bedrooms and an outdoor, country feel. Heres what he found.

title: When It Comes to Picture Books, Santa Sells
description: Have you ever tried to put kids to bed in December? Its a nightmare. Between the anticipation of presents and the jet fuel of Hanukkah gelt, candy canes and gumdrops pilfered from the roof of a gingerbread house, the most patient adult begins to feel like Charlie Browns teacher.

title: Completely at Sea
description: I am not excited to go on a cruise. I am not a cruise person. I dont boat. Ive read my Geoff Dyer and my David Foster Wallace. Ive watched The Perfect Storm a weird number of times. And as much as I love Conrad and Melville, it is not lost on me that stories that take place at sea often end in disaster. Remember, the last word in Wallaces seminal essay A Supposedly Fun Thing Ill Never Do Again is fear.

title: The Most Memorable Wines of 2022
description: Drinking wine is a fleeting pleasure. You sniff, sip, savor it in your mouth, swallow and move onward. Soon enough, the wine is gone.

title: Best Podcasts of 2022
description: I tend to think of this list not as an objective ranking (as if such a thing were possible) but as a kind of tip sheet  more Michelin Guide than the Worlds 50 Best Restaurants. These were shows, presented here in alphabetical order, that excelled at the mission they set for themselves, whether it was dissecting the week in news and culture, changing the way we think about our wardrobes, or traveling the world to capture the sound of wanderlust. Casual and avid podcast listeners alike should walk away with a clear sense of what the medium can do.

title: 2022 Reading Picks From Times Staff Critics
description: This year, in a first, The Timess staff book critics joined the Book Reviews editors in discussing and debating the titles that ended up in contention for our annual 10 best books list. But as readers inevitably do, they also cherished a more personal and idiosyncratic set of books, the ones that spoke to them on account of great characters or great writing, surprising information or heartfelt vulnerability or sheer entertainment value. Herewith, three of our critics discuss the books that have stayed with them throughout 2022.

title: The Team Each and Every American Should Root For
description: THREE RIVERS, Mich.  We didnt forget your sign!

title: 20 Cookie Videos That Will Put You in the Holiday Spirit
description: Come December of every year, New York Times Cooking turns its focus to what else but  cookies. Cookie Week has become a Cooking tradition, with special recipes and even more special videos to show off the very best our staff and freelancers have to offer. The videos below are a collection of Cookie Weeks past and present, each one arguably more joyous than the last. Watch the videos, then cook along, and soon perhaps Cookie Week will become a tradition for you, too.

title: How to Upcycle Your Wedding Dress
description: Weddings may be a once-in-a-lifetime occasion for most people, but that doesnt mean their wedding attire has to be stored away, never to be seen again, afterward. Many brides are finding new ways to repurpose their dresses.

title: The Georgia Republican Unscathed by Walkers Defeat
description: ATLANTA  As Republicans smarting from Herschel Walkers defeat in Georgia continue the process of assigning blame, one man seems to be conspicuously above reproach: Gov. Brian P. Kemp.

title: Prominent Gay Republicans Helped Smooth the Way for Marriage Bill
description: WASHINGTON  When the Senate passed landmark legislation last month to mandate federal recognition for same-sex marriages, the vote was lauded as a rare moment of bipartisanship at a time of deep political polarization in the country.

title: Tiny Vanuatu Uses Its Unimportance to Launch Big Climate Ideas
description: Nikenike Vurobaravu presides over a tiny country with a large hand in climate diplomacy.

title: The Cienfuegos Affair: Inside the Case that Upended the Drug War in Mexico
description: When the Cienfuegos family landed at Los Angeles International Airport on Oct. 15, 2020, they looked excited and maybe a bit relieved. With the pandemic still ravaging Mexico, they had come to vacation in Southern California. Arranging such a visit wasnt a problem, even on short notice: The patriarch, retired Gen. Salvador Cienfuegos Zepeda, had made powerful American friends during his six years as Mexicos defense minister. When he needed a favor  like visas for his wife, daughters and granddaughters  he could still call someone at the Pentagon or the C.I.A.

title: What Twitter Does to Our Sense of Time
description: The past few weeks, watching people weigh alternatives to Twitter, Ive been reminded of a moment that occurs in every episode of Tidying Up With Marie Kondo. She makes her clients put every piece of clothing they own into a giant (often horrifying) pile before going through it, holding and addressing each garment individually. Although Kondo is sometimes written off as a minimalist who tells you to get rid of everything, to me, her work has more to do with intention and cultivating meaningful ties to the things you have. Clients on the show often end up reckoning with their identities  who they are and who they want to be  and with fundamental shifts theyve been too scared or busy to take on. For Kondo, to arrange your things is to arrange your best self and your idea of the good life.

title: Inside the Fight to Pay Food Delivery Workers $23 an Hour
description: William Medina, a delivery worker in Queens, waits for orders to trickle in from DoorDash and Grubhub. Thirty minutes can go by without a single order. Sometimes an hour.

title: The (Incomplete) Revolution in Counting Abortions
description: Among women in the United States who no longer have an abortion clinic nearby, many are turning to abortion pills ordered online, outside the U.S. medical system. As a result, the illicit abortions that were once invisible  the back-alley abortions before Roe v. Wade  are becoming increasingly possible to track and count in post-Roe America.

title: Ruing Senate Loss, Georgia G.O.P. Asks if Runoff Rule Changes Backfired
description: As Georgia Democrats won their third Senate runoff election in two years, the party proved it had crafted an effective strategy for triumphing in a decades-old system created to sustain segregationist power and for overcoming an array of efforts to making voting more difficult. Republicans, meanwhile, were quietly cursing the runoff system, or at least their strategy for winning under a state law they wrote after losing the last election.

title: Kids Arent Learning to Read. This Mom Has a Surprising Solution.
description: Naomi Peas son Jonah was in first grade when he was diagnosed with dyslexia. Its the most common learning disability  20 percent of the U.S. population is dyslexic  but as Pea quickly discovered, getting dyslexic kids help with learning to read in the public school system is extraordinarily difficult. Now, she is part of a growing movement, led by the parents of dyslexic students, to change how all children are taught to read.

title: Shaping the Future of a New American Pottery Company
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  The process of shaping thick disks of clay into dinner plates takes seconds using a roller tool, a machine on which revolving hunks of clay are pressed into symmetrical circles one by one. After the plates are pressed and travel through a dryer, the edges are deftly hand trimmed as they spin around on a different machine. The pieces are then fired in a kiln, glazed and fired again.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Jazz Vocals
description: Lately The New York Times has asked jazz musicians, writers and scholars to share the favorites that would make a friend fall in love with Duke Ellington, Alice Coltrane, bebop and Ornette Coleman.

title: How the Global Spyware Industry Spiraled Out of Control
description: The Biden administration took a public stand last year against the abuse of spyware to target human rights activists, dissidents and journalists: It blacklisted the most notorious maker of the hacking tools, the Israeli firm NSO Group.

title: State Officials Seek to Revisit Sports-Betting Arrangements
description: For the past four years, the campaign to legalize online sports betting has appeared all but unstoppable. In recent weeks, though, some of the momentum has slowed.

title: In Appalachia, Margo Miller Leads From a Place of Courageous Joy
description: Transforming Spaces is a new series about women driving change in sometimes unexpected places.

title: Ebola Could Have Wiped Us All: Slow Lockdown Haunts Uganda
description: As an outbreak of Ebola swept through central Uganda in late September, government officials were willing to do anything to contain the virus except take one crucial step: impose a lockdown.

title: The Best Childrens Books of 2022
description: Rather than follow the Anglocentric pattern of apple, ball and cat, this multilingual alphabet book looks across a wide variety of languages to create a new abecedarium.

title: How Will China Turn Its Economy Back On? The World Is About to Find Out.
description: For months, investors and C.E.O.s waited anxiously for China to ease up on its Covid restrictions, which burdened the economy and were out of sync with the rest of the world. Stock markets rallied on mere rumors of policy changes. Companies warned that zero Covid was hurting business.

title: Read the Intellexa Pitch on Its Spyware Tool
description: The New York Times obtained a copy of a nine-page Intellexa pitch for Predator to a Ukrainian intelligence agency in 2021, the first full such commercial spyware proposal to be made public.

title: Stadiums as High Art in a World Cup Fantasyland
description: AL KHOR, Qatar  Its hard to convey how strange it is to come upon Al Bayt Stadium, an enormous stylized tent decorated with black stripes, for the first time. Designed for the World Cup as a homage to traditional nomadic dwellings, Al Bayt, the centerpiece of a manicured park 22 miles north of Doha, rises as if from nowhere and seems at once apt and incongruous, spectacular and otherworldly  an oasis in the desert, or maybe just a mirage.

title: Zero Covid, Once Ubiquitous, Vanishes in Chinas Messy Pivot
description: A day after Chinas ruling Communist Party announced a broad rollback of the zero Covid restrictions that had smothered the economy and transformed life in the country, the propaganda apparatus on Thursday began the daunting task of promoting an audacious revision of history.

title: Systemic Problems Hindered Governments Pandemic Response, Senate Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  A new examination by Senate Democrats of how the federal government bungled its early response to the coronavirus pandemic faults President Donald J. Trump and his administration for numerous missteps while also laying blame on multiple systemic problems that long predated his time in office.

title: Why Haiti Asked for an Intervention
description: Haiti is unraveling. Gangs control much of the capital, thousands have been displaced and hundreds more are dead.

title: Britain Approves New Coal Mine Despite Climate Concerns
description: The British government approved on Wednesday the countrys first coal mine in decades, a project promoted as a source of new jobs but which has been criticized as a reversal of efforts to control climate change.

title: A Smarter Robot
description: Social medias newest star is a robot: a program called ChatGPT that tries to answer questions like a person.

title: Blanquita Review: The Victims Dilemma
description: In the opening minutes of Blanquita, an adolescent boy, the victim of a child sex ring prone to violent breakdowns, is deemed psychologically unfit to testify against his abusers, terminating the case.

title: Idina Menzel: Which Way to the Stage? Review: Wickedly Talented
description: Our expanding catalog of glossy celebrity bio-documentaries gains a new entry in Idina Menzel: Which Way to the Stage?, which trails its subject on a national tour in 2018. The concerts saw Menzel performing musical highlights from throughout her career, including a medley of show-tunes, original pop numbers and singalongs.

title: Nr. 10 Review: A Strange Joke, Too Dryly Delivered
description: An actor is having an affair with the co-star of his latest play. The plays director, who is the co-stars husband, is suspicious. The actors daughter is secretly recording rehearsals on a video camera. Another man is tracking the actors every movement from a distance, and elsewhere, a sneering priest watches athletic competitions while receiving status reports on the actor from afar.

title: Hidden Letters Review: Sororal Secrets
description: Throughout history, women have survived the stifling strictures of patriarchy by using their own codes of communication  be it intergenerational secrets, whisper networks or gestures legible only to other women. Several centuries ago, in Jiangyong County in southern China, women went a step further, inventing an entire language that they used to write songs, poetry and furtive missives to one another.

title: Review: The Treasure of His Youth: The Photographs of Paolo Di Paolo Delights
description: Late in this charming, exhilarating and revelatory documentary, Paolo Di Paolo, a prominent Italian photojournalist from the late 1950s who quietly and deliberately dropped off the map at the end of the 1960s, recalls a bittersweet love affair. It was with a woman several rungs above him on the social ladder (she is not named, although Di Paolos portraits of her are shown) who, when she called off the affair, told him I will always be who I am. You are just a big paparazzo.

title: Empire of Light Review: They Found It at the Movies
description: Empire of Light takes place in and around an old movie palace in a British seaside town. This cinema, which is called the Empire, is more than a mere setting: its the movies center of gravity, its soul, its governing metaphor and reason for being.

title: To the End Review: Seeing Red While Left on Read
description: The last image that flashes before the title card on the documentary To the End is video captured from inside a car as it drives through a forest engulfed in flames. The footage shows the inferno of Californias wildfire season, and more than any image that follows, this opening presents a stark view of the apocalyptic effects of global climate change.

title: Kojin Karatani Wins $1 Million Berggruen Prize
description: Over his long paradigm-busting career, the philosopher Kojin Karatani has recast Kant and Marx for a new generation. He has offered a trenchant critique of the limits of global capitalism. And he has engaged with other leading thinkers like Jacques Derrida, becoming one of the most important literary critics and philosophers in his native Japan.

title: One Fine Morning Review: The Moments That Make Up a Rich Life
description: Sandra, the French single mother at the center of One Fine Morning, is always in motion, striding here and there, racing up and down, circling back and forth, and always with an intensity of purpose. With her head held high and her clear, unwavering gaze, a dowdy backpack strapped to her back, she doesnt resemble one of pop cultures fantasy gamines. She looks like the woman she is: a mother, daughter, friend, lover and worker who, in order to keep going, needs to maintain a steady course even when buffeted by strong winds.

title: 2/Duo Review: Relationship Rituals
description: Regular film festival attendees might recognize the name of the Japanese director Nobuhiro Suwa (H Story and A Perfect Couple). But his 1997 feature, 2/Duo, is only now receiving a New York release; its showing in tandem with a series at Metrograph on Japanese indies from the punk years. But little about 2/Duo is particularly punk.

title: Loudmouth Review: Portrait of the Firebrand Preacher as a Young Man
description: In the sympathetic documentary Loudmouth, the Rev. Al Sharpton recounts the time Coretta Scott King admonished him for his rhetorical excesses. The films writer-director, Josh Alexander, cuts between the Sharpton of now  svelte, measured  and, using archival footage, the young man he was in the 1980s: rotund, passionate and plying his skills as a preacher to harness the anger and grief of those African Americans gathered at churches, rallies and marches in a time of heightened racial violence.

title: A Stunning 1,300-Year-Old Gold Necklace Is Unearthed in England
description: A 1,300-year-old gold-and-gemstone necklace that was recently discovered in an ancient grave site in England may have belonged to a woman who was an early Christian leader, according to experts involved in the discovery.

title: How Old Are You? South Korea Tries to Simplify What Should Be a Simple Question.
description: SEOUL  Next year, South Koreans will turn a year or two younger  if only on paper.

title: Iran Executes Man Over Nationwide Protests
description: The Iranian government announced that it had hanged a 23-year-old prisoner on Thursday, the first known execution of a person arrested in the protests that have engulfed the country for the past three months.

title: Far-Right Group Suspected in German Plot Gained Strength From QAnon
description: BERLIN  A ragtag band that had been dismissed as wacky and harmless gadflies, the Reichsbrger, or Citizens of the Reich, has tilted at windmills on Germanys far-right political fringe for decades.

title: Brittney Griner Is Freed as Part of a Prisoner Swap With Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Brittney Griner, the American basketball star imprisoned in Russia on drug charges, was released on Thursday after nearly 10 months of captivity in a prisoner swap for Viktor Bout, a convicted Russian arms dealer known as the Merchant of Death.

title: The Legal Heat Grows for Bankman-Fried
description: Since the collapse of the crypto exchange FTX last month, its founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, has faced an array of investigations worldwide into how his empire imploded  and how billions of dollars worth of customer money disappeared.

title: Griners release puts a spotlight on Paul Whelan, another American imprisoned in Russia.
description: The release on Thursday of Brittney Griner, the American basketball star imprisoned in Russia, also puts a spotlight on Paul Whelan, another American imprisoned in the country, and President Biden said that the administration was continuing to work for his release.

title: Who Is Viktor Bout, the Arms Dealer in the Swap for Brittney Griner?
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: What Housing Trends Emerged in California in 2022
description: Its Thursday. Were talking about this years housing trends and what to pay attention to in 2023. Plus, Los Angeles greets rising Covid cases with apathy.

title: The Best College Towns for Students on a Budget
description: College costs have long been in the stratosphere, and record inflation is only putting more stress on student budgets. Student loan forgiveness is in the air (and in the courts), but even if President Bidens plan, which forgives up to $20,000 in debt for millions of federal borrowers, is enacted, it wont help student borrowers with their future college costs, housing among them.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: A four-bedroom, four-full-and-two-half bath, 5,517-square-foot house custom built in 1995, with vaulted ceilings in the living room and foyer, a floor-to-ceiling stone fireplace, a second-story balcony, a large kitchen with an octagonal breakfast room, a two-story library with a gas fireplace, a sun room, a finished basement, an attached three-car garage, a fenced-in yard, a partially covered patio and a firepit, on 0.58 acres. Douglass Holmes, Howard Hanna Rand Realty, 973-568-2224; howardhanna.com

title: A Show of Quiet Dissidence
description: Most political art destined for galleries and art fairs has zero effect on the larger world, yet artists keep making it. Why? In hopes of soothing their souls and shaping the collective karma, I guess. A cohort of 17 such karmic point-scorers make up Paint the Protest at Off Paradise, a group show organized by Nancy Spector, the former artistic director and chief curator of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: A one-bedroom, one-bath, 800-square-foot prewar apartment with a living room that has a fireplace and built-in bookshelves, a dining room currently used as a home office, a windowed galley kitchen with a dishwasher, a windowed bath, and parquet floors, on the eighth floor of an 11-story doorman elevator building with a landscaped courtyard, a basement laundry room and a live-in superintendent. Christine Miller Martin, Compass, 917-453-5152; compass.com

title: The Covid Pandemics Hidden Casualties: Pregnant Women
description: Of all the groups still threatened by Covid-19  including the elderly and the immunocompromised  it is pregnant women who seem the most unaware of the risks.

title: Zadie Smiths Play to Make Its New York Debut During BAMs Spring Season
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music gave a fuller picture of its spring season on Thursday, announcing the New York debut of the novelist Zadie Smiths first play, The Wife of Willesden, and performances by Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater and Pina Bauschs Tanztheater Wuppertal. A revival of Lorraine Hansberrys drama The Sign in Sidney Brusteins Window and a spring music series by the pop star Solange Knowles were announced earlier this fall.

title: With Eyes on Iran, Artists Bring Protests to Roosevelt Island
description: A hand holds a burning white hijab. Scattered behind it are incongruously pink reproductions of a computed tomography scan showing blunt force trauma to the head. The pointed image is an enormous photo print by the Iranian American artist Sheida Soleimani, currently on display in front of a former smallpox hospital on Roosevelt Island.

title: Lace, That Most Coveted Textile
description: You never know what you dont know, until, suddenly, you do. Who doesnt love Vermeers 1669-70 painting, The Lacemaker, with its soft light and aura of beatific, if not virginal concentration? But who knows, exactly, what the young woman it depicts is up to?

title: The Fall of Wirecard, a Tech Scandal That Rocked Germany, Reaches a Courtroom
description: The fraud trial of the former head of Wirecard, the German electronic payments company that went from being the darling of Europes start-up scene to a spectacular fall that led to changes in Germanys financial oversight, began on Thursday in Munich.

title: Chanel Goes to Africa
description: It could have gone badly wrong. The optics of Chanel, one of the most haute of all European haute luxury brands, parachuting into Africa, a continent where they have no stores and no meaningful business, with a bells and whistles one-off fashion show, could have smacked, loudly, of colonialism.

title: Scientists Have Designed a Vagina on a Chip
description: Dr. Don Ingber makes organs for a living. Using flexible pieces of silicone carved with tiny channels, he grows tissues that can mimic the complex physical interactions between cells and fluids, creating malleable, three-dimensional models of organs.

title: The Big Question: Why Do We Tell Stories?
description: This article is part of a series called Turning Points, in which writers explore what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead. You can read more by visiting the Turning Points series page.

title: Today, my family is whole: Cherelle Griner celebrates the release of her wife, Brittney Griner.
description: Cherelle Griner, the wife of basketball star Brittney Griner, stood next to President Biden at the White House during his announcement about her wifes release on Thursday and said she had endured some of the darkest moments of her life since her partners arrest in Moscow in February.

title: China and Saudi Arabia Sign Strategic Partnership as Xi Visits Kingdom
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  Saudi Arabia and China signed a strategic partnership agreement on Thursday during a visit by the Chinese leader Xi Jinping to the kingdom, underlining the growing ties between Beijing and a longstanding American ally that is seeking greater self-reliance.

title: Celine Dion Says She Has a Rare Neurological Disorder
description: In an emotional Instagram video on Thursday, the Canadian pop superstar Celine Dion announced that a severe neurological disorder had forced her to cancel and reschedule dates on her planned 2023 tour.

title: 15 Fresh Takes on a Classic Tradition: The Holiday Album
description: Holiday albums are more than background music played in the weeks between Thanksgiving and New Years Eve. They offer artists a chance to recontextualize themselves, play around in a nostalgic format, reinvent traditions and even strike gold in whats become a lucrative season for the music business. Heres a spin through 15 of the latest releases.

title: Merrily We Roll Along Was Sondheims Big Flop. Can She Save It?
description: In the beginning, everybody cried. A lot.

title: Brains, Brawn or Both: What Drove the Creation of Modern Dog Breeds?
description: In creating modern dog breeds, humans sculpted canines into physical specimens perfectly suited for a wide variety of tasks. Bernese mountain dogs have solid, muscular bodies capable of pulling heavy loads, while greyhounds have lean, aerodynamic frames, ideal for chasing down deer. The compact Jack Russell terrier can easily shimmy into fox or badger dens.

title: Carry Your Groceries, Take the Stairs: Short, Intense Movement Can Improve Your Health
description: Dashing up the stairs to your apartment, weaving between commuters as you dart toward the train  those small snippets of exercise, if theyre intense enough, can add up, according to a new study. The paper is among the first to examine what many exercise scientists have long hypothesized: A little bit of physical activity goes a long way, even movement you might not consider a workout.

title: Bill to Protect Same-Sex Marriage Rights Clears Congress
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Thursday gave final approval to legislation to mandate federal recognition for same-sex marriages, with a bipartisan coalition of lawmakers voting in favor of the measure in the waning days of the Democratic-led Congress.

title: In a Candy Pink Villa, a Designer Creates a World of His Own
description: The houses that line the leafy streets of the Malarhojden suburb of Stockholm are mostly traditional wooden single-family homes in muted Nordic hues: gray, cream, white. But when Luca Nichetto, an Italian-born, Sweden-based designer, visited the area during a snowstorm at the tail end of 2020 he was drawn to a 1930s villa in a washed-out shade of pink. In a country thats always dark and cold, he says, its nice to have an environment thats a little more colorful.

title: Yellen Is First Female Treasury Secretary With Signature on U.S. Dollar
description: WASHINGTON  During a recent appearance on The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen faced an awkward question: After nearly two years in the job, why was the signature of her predecessor, Steven T. Mnuchin, still scrawled across the nations currency?

title: BG is FREE!!! Sports Figures Celebrate Brittney Griners Release
description: Within minutes of the White Houses announcement of the release of Brittney Griner, the American basketball star imprisoned in Russia, support and relief poured in from across the sports world  especially from the W.N.B.A., which for months has been advocating for her freedom.

title: Something From Tiffanys Review: Put a Ring on It
description: Romantic comedies rarely go wrong when they include some combination of mishaps, mistakes and mix-ups  all those fateful accidents that bring together strangers and glorify the wonder of cosmic serendipity. A really piquant imbroglio is rom-com gold: see The Shop Around the Corner (adversarial co-workers unwittingly strike up a romance by mail), I Love You Again (a husband on the verge of divorce gets amnesia and attempts to re-woo his own wife), While You Were Sleeping (a train fare collector is embroiled in family drama after being confused for a comatose commuters fiance), or any number of other classics of the genre.

title: Congress Says Dan Snyder and the N.F.L. Impeded Sexual Harassment Investigation
description: The Washington Commanders owner Daniel Snyder, aided by N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell, suppressed evidence that Snyder and team executives sexually harassed women who worked at the team over two decades, according to the results of a yearlong inquiry by the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

title: After 65 Years, the Boy in the Box Has a Name
description: On a cold day in February 1957, a college student found a boys body inside a cardboard box in a wooded area of northeast Philadelphia.

title: Read the Full Report on the Washington Commanders
description: A report by the House Committee on Oversight and Reform found that the Washington Commanders owner Daniel Snyder, aided by the N.F.L., worked to suppress evidence in an investigation of sexual harassment claims made against Snyder and the team. The committee also said Snyder went to extraordinary lengths to stall investigations into him and his team.

title: Advocates for Mentally Ill New Yorkers Ask Court to Halt Removal Plan
description: New York Citys new plan to take more mentally ill homeless people to hospitals against their will if they are deemed a danger to themselves met its first legal challenge on Thursday.

title: Jerrod Carmichael to Host Golden Globes as Broadcast Returns From Scandal
description: The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael will serve as host of the Golden Globes next month, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association announced Thursday. Its the first time the tarnished film and television awards ceremony will be broadcast since a 2021 scandal over the ethics and diversity of the H.F.P.A., the group behind the Globes.

title: Bidens Hopes for Sweden and Finland in NATO Are Stuck on Erdogans Demands
description: WASHINGTON  When President Biden hosted the leaders of Finland and Sweden at the White House this year, he spoke in triumphal terms about their decision to join NATO after decades of neutrality, inthe latest blow to President Vladimir V. Putins efforts to undermine the alliance. It was, Mr. Biden said, a momentous day.

title: 5 New Recipes to Get Excited About
description: I think it has something to do with these short, cold, dark days in the lull between the holidays, and the shortness of time and energy that tends to come with them; lately, Ive been leaning on comfort dishes that I can cook by heart.

title: The Last Stand of Soccers Greatest Generation
description: DOHA, Qatar  One by one, they have exited the World Cup stage that has been theirs for so long. Some, like Luis Surez, restless and helpless, on the substitutes bench, could not hold back their tears. Others, like Romelu Lukaku and Edinson Cavani, lashed out at whatever inanimate object crossed their path, unable to contain their rage.

title: Assessing the Competence of Older Doctors
description: To the Editor:

title: Read the Republican Response to the Report
description: Republican members of the House Committee on Oversight and Reform wrote a memo to respond to the committees findings in its Washington Commanders investigation. The memo, submitted with excerpts from some of the committees depositions, called the investigation a sham intended to harass a private business and depose its owner.

title: Johnny Johnson, the Last World War II Dambuster, Dies at 101
description: In the hours before dawn on May 17, 1943, airmen from Britain and its commonwealth carried out an audacious low-level raid on Germanys industrial heartland, the Ruhr region. They dropped specially designed bombs that breached two major dams and damaged another, creating massive floods in a dramatic strike against the Nazi war machine. The torrent destroyed war plants, power stations, bridges, railroads and roads; devastated farmland; and washed away towns.

title: American Given 8-Month Suspended Sentence in Traffic Death of British Teen
description: LONDON  Anne Sacoolas, an American who fled Britain in 2019 after fatally striking a teenager with her car, has been handed an eight-month suspended sentence, which likely means she will never face time behind bars.

title: Christmas Kitsch, No Longer Full of Hot Air
description: Move over blow-up snowmen. This year, hollow plastic light-up figures are making a comeback and giving those inflatable fabric ornaments  the type with the fan inside  a run for their money.

title: Harry & Meghan: What People Are Saying About the Netflix Series
description: These days in Britain, very little unites the right and left. Harry & Meghan, the intimate Netflix series released Thursday, is quickly shaping up to be the exception.

title: Adams Plan Would Relax Rules for Developers Amid N.Y.C. Housing Crisis
description: Mayor Eric Adams announced a plan on Thursday to combat New York Citys affordable housing crisis by streamlining some of the citys many rules and requirements that he said have slowed the construction of new homes at a moment when they are desperately needed.

title: The number of Americans wrongfully detained by other nations has risen.
description: Brittney Griner may have been the highest-profile American whose detention abroad was deemed wrongful by the U.S. State Department, but she was hardly the only one: The number of American citizens unjustly or wrongfully detained by foreign governments has risen sharply in recent decades, researchers have found.

title: Dick Rivington & the Cat Review: A Civic-Minded Holiday Treat
description: New York City has a rat problem, but this holiday season one neighborhood is dealing with the menace: There is a new fearless cat on the Lower East Side, and he can take down an awful lot of vermin. He can also crack wise, twerk and land somersaults, because we are in the wacky land of pantomime, not the 6 oclock news.

title: House Passes $858 Billion Defense Bill Repealing Vaccine Mandate for Troops
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Thursday overwhelmingly passed an $858 billion defense policy bill that would rescind the Pentagons mandate that troops receive the coronavirus vaccine, pushing past the objections of the Biden administration as lawmakers in both parties united behind another huge increase in military spending.

title: F.D.A. Authorizes Updated Covid Shots for Children as Young as 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday expanded eligibility for the updated coronavirus shots to children as young as 6 months old, the latest step to make the retooled doses available to more Americans.

title: N.F.L. Week 14 Predictions: Our Picks for Each Game
description: At first glance, it may seem strange that there are multiple games this week in which the team with the better record is the underdog. The Ravens (8-4) are getting points against the Steelers (5-7), and though San Francisco (8-4) is favored against the Buccaneers (6-6), the close line can be explained by injuries to the starting quarterbacks.

title: F.T.C. Sues to Block Microsofts $69 Billion Acquisition of Activision
description: The Federal Trade Commission, in one of the most aggressive actions taken by federal regulators in decades to check the power of the tech industrys giants, on Thursday sued to block Microsofts $69 billion acquisition of the video game maker Activision Blizzard.

title: Saying Goodbye to Magic Realism
description: This personal reflection is part of a series called Turning Points, in which writers explore what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead. You can read more by visiting the Turning Points series page.

title: Surprise. The Villain So Far in Harry & Meghan Is Not the Royal Family.
description: LONDON  For weeks, British newspapers speculated feverishly about who would be most damaged by the claims of Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, in a much-anticipated six-part documentary series that premiered Thursday on Netflix.

title: Russian state media releases video footage of the Brittney Griner prisoner swap.
description: Russias state media on Thursday released video footage of the prisoner exchange of Brittney Griner, the American W.N.B.A. star, and Viktor Bout, the convicted Russian arms dealer known as the Merchant of Death, at an airport in the United Arab Emirates.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Griner Freed in Swap for Russian Arms Dealer
description: Brittney Griner, the American basketball star imprisoned in Russia, was released in an exchange for the convicted Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout. President Biden said Griner had landed safely in the United Arab Emirates and would be back in the U.S. within 24 hours.

title: News Analysis: In Brittney Griner Deal, Putin Used Pain, a Familiar Lever
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia wants to prosecute his war in Ukraine in the same way he secured the freedom on Thursday of a major Russian arms dealer: inflict so much pain on Western governments that, eventually, they make a deal.

title: The 39 House Republicans Who Voted for the Same-Sex Marriage Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Legislation to mandate federal recognition for same-sex marriages cleared Congress on Thursday after passing both chambers with bipartisan support.

title: Jim Stewart, Unlikely Entrepreneur of Soul Music, Dies at 92
description: Jim Stewart, who with his sister founded Stax Records, home to R&B luminaries like Otis Redding and Sam & Dave  and, after Motown, the best-selling soul music label of the 1960s and 70s  died on Monday in Memphis. He was 92.

title: Who Is Dina Boluarte, the New President of Peru?
description: Like the man she replaced, she is a leftist who grew up far from the capital, with a strong connection to her mostly poor mountainous region.

title: 11 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: A hundred years after the publication of The Waste Land, theres still more to learn about T.S. Eliots modernist masterpiece: As Lyndall Gordon explains in her new book, The Hyacinth Girl (and as Robert Crawford explained in an Eliot biography earlier this year), the poets recently unsealed letters to his beloved Emily Hale reveal just how much inspiration he drew from their secret and unconsummated passion. My love for you has steadily grown into something finer and finer, Eliot wrote, directing Hale to see herself in the poems hyacinth girl lines. I shall always write primarily for you.

title: Biden Devotes $36 Billion to Save Union Workers Pensions
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden announced Thursday that he was investing $36 billion in federal funds to save the pensions of more than 350,000 union workers and retirees, a demonstration of commitment to labor just a week after a rupture over an imposed settlement of a threatened rail strike.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What Students Are Saying About Celebrities Who Publicly Share Their Struggles
description: Selena Gomez speaks about her experiences with bipolar disorder, lupus, anxiety and psychosis in a documentary called Selena Gomez: My Mind & Me. Taylor Swift sings about feeling depressed and out of place in her hit song Anti-Hero. Adele, Lady Gaga and Ariana Grande are open about their struggles with anxiety, depression and panic attacks. Megan Thee Stallion has a song called Anxiety and has launched a website dedicated to mental health.

title: What Is Stiff Person Syndrome?
description: Pop superstar Celine Dion announced Thursday that she is canceling and rescheduling her planned 2023 tour dates after being diagnosed with stiff person syndrome, a rare neurological condition.

title: Is the Supreme Court About to Upend American Election Laws?
description: For months, my inbox has been bombarded by anxious Democrats and election experts wanting to talk about a once-obscure legal theory that could fundamentally alter the way Americans vote.

title: Prosecutor Says Colorado Shooting Suspects Family Did Not Cooperate in Prior Case
description: The person accused of opening deadly fire in an L.G.B.T.Q. nightclub in Colorado last month had earlier felony charges dropped because family members who the authorities say had been threatened with weapons, ammunition and a homemade bomb would not cooperate with prosecutors, the chief prosecutor in Colorado Springs said on Thursday.

title: Special Masters Review in Trump Case Ends as Appeal Courts Ruling Takes Effect
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court on Thursday brought to an end a special masters review of sensitive documents the F.B.I. had seized from former President Donald J. Trumps private club and residence in Florida, concluding a court fight that had delayed the Justice Departments investigation for nearly three months.

title: Key Partner in Covax Will Stop Giving Free Vaccines to Middle-Income Nations
description: A key partner in Covax, the organization that has led the effort to bring Covid vaccines to poor and middle-income countries, will stop supplying the shots to a huge part of the global population in the year ahead, and provide them only to the lowest-income nations.

title: Brittney Griner Is Being Taken to an Army Hospital in San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO  Brittney Griners first stop when she arrives back in the United States will be not her home in Phoenix, but the Brooke Army Medical Center in San Antonio.

title: How to Fend Off Holiday Stress, from People Who Should Know
description: Hello! Im Jancee Dunn, the new writer of Wells newsletter.

title: Mayor Eric Adams Wins Fight Over Rat Infestation Fine
description: Eric Adams  mayor, landlord and apparently a New Yorker like everyone else  has beaten a $300 ticket for a rat infestation at his rental property in Brooklyn.

title: Statement in a Closing Argument
description: Jump to: Tricky Clues

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: SPLIT DECISIONS  I noticed a pattern in this latest installment of Fred Piscops Split Decisions puzzle, a commonality among four of the longer entries. It didnt sink in until I was finished, but all four of those entries helped me greatly with my solve, and I wondered if anyone else noticed the pattern too.

title: Review: Who Committed the Ohio State Murders? Who Didnt?
description: Two 91-year-old titans made belated Broadway debuts this fall.

title: Day 9: The Magic of Less Holiday Magic
description: Isabel Spooner-Harvey used to make latkes from scratch: grating the potatoes, wringing out their water, frying them over a hot stove.

title: Winning the Long Game in Love
description: Carolyn Elizabeth Cost and Patrick James Sheehan posed playfully for a random photo in March 2013 as their paths crossed briefly at Shroom, an annual high school party held at Frick Park in Pittsburgh.

title: They Found Love in an Elevator
description: During a vacation in Isla Holbox, Mexico, in July 2021, Rachel Stephanie Serrano suspected that Nicolas Alan Platt wanted to propose. Mr. Platt, her boyfriend of five years was acting nervous and when they went to watch the sunset on the beach, he brought a GoPro camera and a drone.

title: Fish and Chips (and a Kiss) Sealed the Deal
description: For Cherie Rochelle King and Ilka Tiedemann, it proved true that the third times a charm. First, they saw each other. Second, they met each other. Third, they agreed to a date.

title: You Bought the Wrong Nipple Clamps
description: After the third time Charles and I met, I sent him an email that read: You are not Chinese. You are 16 years older than me. You have a daughter out of wedlock. These are the three reasons we cannot be together.

title: Her Fictitious Remember Me Email Sparked a Real Connection
description: In July 2013, Emily Erin Todebush wrote Garrett Odhiambo Arwa an email pretending they knew each other.

title: North Korea Wants Dollars. Its a Sign of Trouble.
description: Kim Jong-un is desperately trying to find hard currency to fund his military and economic ambitions.

title: The Lincoln Tunnel is Phasing Out Cash  Permanently This Time
description: Good morning. Its Friday. Well look at a change thats coming to the Lincoln Tunnel over the weekend  total cashlessness. Well also get details on the citys plan to require app services to pay delivery workers significantly more money.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Brittney Griner, the American basketball star imprisoned in Russia on drug charges, was released yesterday after nearly 10 months of captivity in a prisoner swap for Viktor Bout, a convicted Russian arms dealer. President Biden announced her release in a brief statement. She is returning to the U.S. and was to be examined at a military hospital in Texas.

title: Argentina Just Won the World Cup, and Lionel Messi Is the Perfect Man for This Moment
description: News update: Argentina beat France during a penalty shootout in the World Cup final on Sunday, delivering the first World Cup trophy for its star, Lionel Messi.

title: Inside the Frantic Texts Exchanged by Crypto Executives as FTX Collapsed
description: The day before the embattled cryptocurrency exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy, Changpeng Zhao, the chief executive of the rival exchange Binance, sent an alarmed text to Sam Bankman-Fried, FTXs founder.

title: Word of the Day: perpetuity
description: The word perpetuity has appeared in 52 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Oct. 30 in One More Project for David Geffen: Building His Legacy by Adam Nagourney:

title: New Zealand on a Plate
description: 36 Hours is a weekly New York Times column about spending a weekend in a city somewhere in the world. This weeks, by me, is about Wellington, the New Zealand capital.

title: The Gift
description: Tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of  or use your imagination to write the opening of a short story or poem inspired by the illustration.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Making My Red (Well, Blue) Carpet Reporting Debut
description: Last week, I found myself awake in the wee morning hours, anxiously Googling things like what to wear to cover a movie premiere and red carpet question ideas.

title: Tourists Rush to See Mauna Loas Rare Eruption
description: Native Hawaiians held cultural ceremonies for Pele, the goddess of volcanoes and fire, in recent weeks following Mauna Loas first eruption since 1984.

title: Highbrow Films Aimed at Winning Oscars Are Losing Audiences
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A Rush to See Hawaiis Eruption Reveals Social Fissures on the Big Island
description: POHAKULOA, Hawaii  When lava began spewing from the worlds largest active volcano late last month, for the first time since 1984, a surge of tourism followed. As the night sky above Mauna Loa lit up with orange hues, hotels across the Big Island of Hawaii were booked solid, and the National Guard was activated to manage traffic as spectators crowded the road near the volcano, hoping for a glimpse.

title: Trevor Noah Tearfully Signs Off from The Daily Show
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, December 9, 2022
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: 5 Things To Do This Weekend
description: Darren Aronofsky's "The Whale," an art exhibition on lace and a Broadway debut are all among the things to see this weekend.

title: Can ChatGPT Make This Podcast?
description: Its writing podcast scripts, finishing students homework and correcting mistakes in computer code: ChatGPT, the A.I. chatbot from OpenAI, is suddenly everywhere. Who should decide how its built? What could go wrong? And what could go right?

title: Thats Entertainment! Heres a Dishy History of Hollywood.
description: Its not quite The Greatest Story Ever Told. But Hollywood: The Oral History swings equally big in ambition and marketing approach. Which Hollywood history is this, you ask, and whose? The! This is it!

title: How to Get More Men to Try Therapy
description: Mental health experts have long known that while women have nearly twice the rate of depression diagnoses, men are much more likely to die by suicide, drug overdose and alcohol related deaths  sometimes referred to as deaths of despair. Nearly 80 percent of suicides are among men, with males over age 75 and those who work in traditionally blue collar jobs, such as mining, construction and agriculture, having the highest rates.

title: N.Y.P.D. Officers Leave in Droves for Better Pay in Smaller Towns
description: Earlier this year, the chief of police in Aurora, Colo., needed to find a few dozen officers to join his force.

title: On Death Row, He Is Grasping at Grace
description: The State of Texas intended to kill Ramiro Gonzales on July 13. Mr. Gonzales, who is 40, has been on Texas death row for 16 years. He is guilty of having raped and murdered a woman named Bridget Townsend when he was 18 years old and has been incarcerated his entire adult life. For most of that time, he has lived knowing that he may one day have to lie down, say his last words and participate in his own killing.

title: Appearing Less Asian on College Applications: The Week in Reporter Reads
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: How Sam Bankman-Fried Put Effective Altruism on the Defensive
description: The disgraced crypto entrepreneur Sam Bankman-Fried wanted people to know that the enormous risks he took were in the service of humanity  that, at least, was the impression he tried to give on Nov. 30 in an interview at The New York Timess DealBook Summit. The famously jittery Bankman-Fried, who was arrested on Monday night on fraud charges, looked relatively subdued as he Zoomed in for the interview from a dimly lit room in the Bahamas, a tax haven whose regulatory environment was particularly suited to his crypto ambitions.

title: The Fight Terence Crawford Really Wants Isnt This Weekend
description: An optimistic boxing fan could view Terence Crawfords bid to defend his welterweight title in a bout against David Avanesyan, scheduled for Saturday in Omaha, as a semifinal.

title: How Darren Criss Spends His Sundays
description: One would think, given his holiday album, A Very Darren Crissmas, that Darren Criss would be kind of obsessed with Christmas. This is not quite accurate, he said. However, aside from the convenient, yet eye-rolling pun that is the title, it is a very me collection of songs.

title: Three Signals Weve Entered a New Economic Era
description: From the U.S. Federal Reserves initial misjudgment that inflation would be transitory to the current consensus that a probable U.S. recession will be short and shallow, there has been a strong tendency to see economic challenges as both temporary and quickly reversible, writes the economist Mohamed El-Erian. But rather than one more turn of the economic wheel, the world may be experiencing major structural and secular changes that will outlast the current business cycle.

title: How Do You Have Fun?
description: When was the last time you had fun  true fun? The kind of fun that made you laugh your head off, feel like a little kid again and forget all your troubles?

title: Qatar Extends Its Natural Gas Dominance at Russias Expense
description: Russias war in Ukraine has jolted global energy markets, leaving Europe short of natural gas, raising prices for all fossil fuels and threatening a global recession.

title: Tech Layoffs in U.S. Send Foreign Workers Scrambling to Find New Jobs
description: Since Microsoft brought him to the United States 14 years ago, Abhishikt Jain has excelled professionally, raised a family and settled into a four-bedroom house with a garage full of unnecessary stuff, he said.

title: Griners Detention Showed the Strength and the Struggle in Womens Sports
description: Brittney Griners detention in Russia on drug charges could be described through the lens of war and politics, with Griner, one of the worlds best basketball players, a casualty of an international struggle between superpowers.

title: I Will Keep Fighting: Chinas Protesters Say Its Bigger Than Covid
description: After the Chinese government announced this week that it would retreat from its harsh Covid policies, many Chinese expressed their gratitude to the protesters who had boldly spoken out against the punishing restrictions. After three long years, people throughout China could try to get back to normal life.

title: No One Knows What to Do About Trumps 2024 Campaign
description: Everyone knows by now how many Trump candidates lost this year, especially the higher-profile, more hard-core ones who claimed the 2020 election was stolen. Kari Lake lost in Arizona. Doug Mastriano lost in Pennsylvania. Most of the notable pro-Trump secretary of state candidates lost. The Senate candidates, too. The Democrats even added on in Georgia on Tuesday, with the same, central animating force behind each development: that Donald Trump forced his party to run a candidate, Herschel Walker, who lost, weakening Mr. Trump and the party  a mutual descent.

title: 25 Restaurant Dishes We Couldnt Stop Thinking About This Year
description: As you watch the plate being cleared, you think: That was so good. What made that so good? Why isnt there just a little more? Months later, your mind still glances back. I need to get back there.

title: She Preached Death Without Fear. Could She Practice It?
description: Many people hope for a good death, even plan for it, but few prepare for it as thoroughly and cheerfully as Shatzi Weisberger. She had a certificate in the Art of Dying from the Open Center in New York, and she helped run a monthly discussion group on the subject in Brooklyn, and another one in her small Upper West Side apartment.

title: Chasing the U.S., Chinas Leader Emerges From Diplomatic Isolation
description: He met with Saudi Arabias king and the leaders of Egypt, Tunisia, Kuwait and Sudan. He pledged to expand ports along the Red Sea, invest in petrochemicals and usher in a wave of Chinese tourism.

title: Beijing Braces for Covid Surge After China Lifts Pandemic Curbs
description: At a hospital in the affluent Beijing district of Chaoyang, close to 100 people lined up outdoors in near-freezing weather on Friday at a clinic designated for fever patients. Some residents flocked to pharmacies, buying up dwindling stocks of at-home antigen coronavirus test kits and herbal medicines. Many chose to stay home, leaving the capitals usually busy streets quiet except for the puttering of motorbikes driven by food delivery workers.

title: What Is Behind the Political Turmoil in Peru?
description: Peru has been convulsed in recent years by political turmoil, rapid turnovers of presidents and constant scandals and investigations. But this week has perhaps been one of the most tumultuous in the countrys recent history.

title: A Court Case That Could Transform Elections
description: On one level, the case brought before the Supreme Court is about gerrymandering and what can be done by voting maps warped by partisanship. But on a broader level, its about a theory that would completely reorient the relationship between the federal and state governments and upset the ordinary checks and balances.

title: Looking for a House in This Tight Market? Consider an Octagon.
description: Lawrence Mauro is used to strangers gawking at the eight-sided 1860 house he owns in Stockport, N.Y. And for the most part, hes fine with it. But one day a few years ago, the curiosity got out of hand.

title: A Rural Hospitals Excruciating Choice: $3.2 Million a Year or Inpatient Care?
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: With Brittney Griners Release, Anxiety Turns to Relief
description: HOUSTON  Brianna Turner was sleeping Thursday morning when her mother burst into her room to say that Brittney Griner, her teammate on the Phoenix Mercury, had been freed in a prisoner swap after nearly a year of captivity in Russia.

title: Kyrsten Sinema Says She Will Leave the Democratic Party
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona announced on Friday that she would leave the Democratic Party and become an independent, unsettling the party divide anew just days after Democrats secured an expanded majority in the Senate.

title: Glimpses of Democracy
description: Demonstrators are in the streets in Iran and China to protest repressive governments. Ukrainians are defending their democracy, flawed as it is, against Russian invaders. Elections in Africa and Asia resulted in changes in the ruling powers that were accepted without violence.

title: I Live Alone. Really, Im Not That Pathetic.
description: The New York Times is starting to give me a complex.

title: Russia Finds a War Critic Guilty of Spreading False Information
description: MOSCOW  A Russian court on Friday sentenced an opposition politician, Ilya Yashin, to eight and a half years in prison after finding him guilty on charges of spreading false information about atrocities committed in the Ukrainian city of Bucha by Russian troops in February and March.

title: This Case Should Never Have Made It to the Supreme Court
description: The most important case for American democracy in the nations history  thats how the former appeals court judge J. Michael Luttig described Moore v. Harper, an extraordinary lawsuit that the Supreme Court considered in oral arguments Wednesday morning. Judge Luttig, a conservative and a widely respected legal thinker, is not one for overstatement. Yet most Americans arent paying attention to the case because it involves some confusing terminology and an arcane legal theory. It is essential that people understand just how dangerous this case is to the fundamental structure of American government, and that enough justices see the legal fallacies and protect our democracy.

title: The Stakes Behind the F.T.C.s Bid to Block Microsofts Big Deal
description: The Biden administration yesterday took its boldest step yet in challenging the reach of tech giants when the F.T.C. sued to block Microsofts $69 billion takeover of Activision Blizzard.

title: Penguin Random House C.E.O. Steps Down
description: Markus Dohle stepped down from his role as chief executive of Penguin Random House, the publishers parent company, Bertelsmann, announced on Friday, just weeks after an enormously expensive acquisition deal fell apart.

title: Workers at E.V. Battery Plant in Ohio Vote to Unionize
description: In an early test of President Bidens promise that the transition to electric vehicles will create high-paying union jobs, employees at a battery plant in eastern Ohio have voted to join the United Automobile Workers union.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried Agrees to Testify Before House Committee
description: The answer as to whether the embattled FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried will appear before two congressional committees next week is being played out on Twitter.

title: A strong support network is critical after being released from detention, an expert says.
description: With her prison ordeal over, Brittney Griner will now face the challenge of transitioning back into life at home  where a strong support network will be critical, a mental health expert said Friday.

title: Covid Rates Are Climbing in Los Angeles, but Residents Are Weary
description: Its that time of year, when rising Covid cases collide with holiday plans. Hospitalizations in Los Angeles County have nearly tripled in the past month, and the county is talking about a possible mask mandate.

title: The Wednesday Dance Is an Invitation. Be Weird.
description: What is it about the Wednesday dance? She holds you captive from her very first glare.

title: Tell Us How Your Family Uses Alexa
description: Amazon has not figured out how to get customers to buy stuff with Alexa, its digital assistant, which is largely a disappointment for the company. But while Alexa has underperformed as a product for Amazon, we want to know how its performing for the people who really matter: us.

title: N.F.L. Owner by Day, Rock n Roller by Night
description: Jim Irsay is not your typical team owner, especially in the buttoned-up National Football League.

title: Illuminating a Forgotten History
description: This personal reflection is part of a series called Turning Points, in which writers explore what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead. You can read more by visiting the Turning Points series page.

title: Hamish Bowles Lists His High-Design Village Co-op for $2.9 Million
Bangladesh Arrests Opposition Leaders as Crackdown Intensifies
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  The authorities in Bangladesh arrested two senior opposition leaders early on Friday, capping off a week of political tensions, including a major clash between the police and opposition supporters that left at least one demonstrator dead, dozens wounded and hundreds arrested.

title: A Guide to Signing Up for Health Coverage
description: Deductibles. Drug formularies. Not to mention a health insurance option  Cobra  that evokes a deadly reptile.

title: Harry & Meghan Has All the Intimacy of Instagram
description: There is a scene early on in the first episode of Netflixs new Harry & Meghan, the documentary on the members of the British royal family who seceded from the firm, in which Meghan describes her early courtship with the prince. It began, she says, when he saw a photo of her clowning around on a mutual friends Instagram feed. Haz wanted to meet her, the friend said: Was she game? Meghan wasnt sure (first she had to figure out who Haz was). So she did what anyone would do when being potentially set up on a blind date: She checked out his Instagram feed. And was won over by all the photos of wildlife in Africa.

title: How Bad Are Microplastics? An Expert Weighs In.
Mysteries of a Venetian Perfectionist Revealed in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  For Henry James, our man in Italy, There is something ridiculous in talking of Venice without making him almost the refrain.

title: After a Terrible Year for Bonds, the Outlook Is Better
description: This has been an awful year for U.S. bonds  so bad that 2022 may end up as the worst calendar year in history.

title: Animals Are Running Out of Places to Live
description: Talks in Montreal this month could be a big victory, or a missed opportunity, for the planets wildlife. We explain why, and show you some of the species losing habitat fast.

title: Newly Published, From Childrens Books to the Bloomsbury Group
description: CITY UNDER THE CITY, by Dan Yaccarino. (mineditionUS, $18.99, ages 6 to 9.) The children in this comics-style dystopian picture book by the creator of Oswald read only what the Eyes program on their screens, until a young girl follows a small rodent to a city under the city guarded by stone lions and filled with strange-looking objects called books.

title: The Weekender
description: The prestigious college where nannies for elites are trained. Also in this edition: 54 easy snack recipes and the best TV shows of 2022.

title: Judge Declines to Act on Justice Dept. Contempt Request in Trump Documents Case
description: A federal judge in Washington on Friday ended a hearing without acting on a Justice Department request to find representatives of Donald J. Trumps post-presidential office in contempt of court for failing to comply fully with a subpoena demanding that he return all classified documents he had taken with him when he left office, two people familiar with the matter said.

title: When Jewish Artists Wrestle With Antisemitism
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Oil Spill in Kansas Prompts Shutdown of Keystone Pipeline System
description: The Keystone pipeline system was shut down Wednesday night after its operator, TC Energy, said it had detected an oil spill in northern Kansas. Federal environmental officials said the public was not at risk.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. There isnt a much simpler soup than seolleongtang (above), the Korean ox-bone soup, milky white and marrow-rich in flavor. I eat mine alongside a bowl of plain white rice and another of kimchi, and revel in its comforting austerity: a December meal that evokes the season in warmth rather than chill. Look at those bowls of steaming snow beside ones of holly red!

title: Lit Trivia: Can You Identify These Music-Themed Novels?
description: Heres a quick quiz about five novels that use music, musicians or the music industry to help tell the story. Play on!

title: Theyre Taking Jigsaws to Infinity and Beyond
description: PALENVILLE, N.Y.  On a meandering mushroom hunt at North-South Lake in the Catskill Mountains of New York, Jessica Rosenkrantz spotted a favorite mushroom: the hexagonal-pored polypore. Ms. Rosenkrantz is partial to life-forms that are different from humans (and from mammals generally), although two of her favorite humans joined on the hike: her husband, Jesse Louis-Rosenberg, and their toddler, Xyla, who set the pace. Ms. Rosenkrantz loves fungi, lichens and coral because, she said, theyre pretty strange, compared to us. From the top, the hexagonal polypore looks like any boring brown mushroom (albeit sometimes with an orange glow), but flip it over and theres a perfect array of six-sided polygons tessellating the underside of the cap.

title: Heres a look at two Americans still detained in Russian penal colonies.
description: MOSCOW  The State Department has urged U.S. citizens not to travel to Russia and, if they are in the country, to leave immediately because of the possibility of arbitrary arrest.

title: U.K. Government Backs Bill to Criminalize Street Harassment
description: LONDON  The British government on Friday said it was backing a bill that would make street harassment  like catcalling, following someone, and intrusive or persistent staring  a crime punishable by up to two years in prison.

title: China to Cooperate With Gulf Nations on Nuclear Energy and Space, Xi Says
description: China plans to cooperate with Saudi Arabia and other Gulf countries in the fields of nuclear energy, nuclear security and space exploration, President Xi Jinping said on Friday, showcasing his nations strengthening ties with a region that was once firmly in the U.S. sphere of influence.

title: Turkey Is Strengthening Its Energy Ties With Russia
description: As European nations opposed to the invasion of Ukraine have moved to reduce their dependence on Russian oil and gas, enduring soaring price increases and possible shortages, Turkey has deepened its energy ties to Russia.

title: France to Make Condoms Free for Young People
description: PARIS  France will begin offering free condoms in pharmacies for people up to age 25 starting Jan. 1, in a bid to reduce the spread of sexually transmitted diseases, President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday.

title: The Prisoner Exchange That Freed Brittney Griner
description: To the Editor:

title: Inside the Prisoner Swap That Freed Brittney Griner
description: WASHINGTON  Month after month, as American diplomats pushed for the release of Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan from Russian prisons, they received the same, infuriating answer: If you want both prisoners, we want Vadim Krasikov as part of the deal.

title: Best of Late Night This Week
description: This week, the late-night hosts were thrilled that the Trump Organization was found guilty of tax fraud. And after seven seasons behind the Daily Show desk, Trevor Noah said goodbye.

title: Markets Fluctuate at the End of a Shaky Week
description: Stock prices wobbled on Friday after persistent pullbacks over the week reflected how investors have grown increasingly nervous that stubbornly high inflation could push the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates high for a long time, raising the risk of a severe economic downturn.

title: Its a Wonderful Binge Review: A Spiked Christmas
