title: Golden Globes Announce 2023 Nominations After Recent Troubles
description: The companies behind the tarnished Golden Globe Awards pushed forward with a rehabilitation effort on Monday, announcing nominations for a televised ceremony on Jan. 10 that will find The Fabelmans, Elvis and The Banshees of Inisherin among those in contention for the top film prizes.

title: How Layoff News Is Hiding a Hot Job Market
description: Companies like Meta and Twitter have said that they will be cutting jobs. Google and Amazon have announced that they are putting a freeze on any new hiring.

title: Winter Illnesses
description: Covid no longer plays the dominant role that it once did in most of our lives. But the risk of Covid  and other viruses  persists. This winter, experts expect cases, hospitalizations and deaths from viral diseases to rise once again.

title: Snow and Cold Bring Parts of U.K. to a Standstill
description: LONDON A coating of snow and ice on Sunday upended travel in Britain and put increased pressure on the countrys energy supplies, already under strain from a prolonged cold snap.

title: What Would You Pick as Word of the Year?
description: What one word or phrase best sums up 2022 in your opinion? Why?

title: Elon Musks Latest Jab from the Right
description: Since taking over Twitter, Elon Musk has shown a willingness, and sometimes a relish, to pick public fights with an array of targets, including advertisers, tech giants, employees and more.

title: Ukraine says it struck a hotel where members of Russias Wagner security force had gathered.
description: A Ukrainian rocket attack on a hotel in the east of the country killed members of the Wagner Group, a Russian paramilitary force whose leader has close ties to President Vladimir V. Putin, regional Ukrainian military authorities have said.

title: Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic
description: This is Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic, a weekly review of the game that drives me out of my hivemind. In a good way. Sometimes.

title: Wordle Wrap-Up: Dec. 5 to 11
description: Hi Wordlers! Welcome to Wordle Wrap-Up, a reminder of which words were answers this week. For stories, stats and brain teasers, sign up for the Gameplay newsletter. For a daily reminder to play Wordle, sign up for reminders.

title: Karen Bass Becomes Los Angeles Mayor
description: LOS ANGELES  In front of thousands of people packed into a downtown auditorium on Sunday, Karen Bass was sworn in by Vice President Kamala Harris as Los Angeless 43rd mayor  and the first female mayor of the nations second-biggest city.

title: Scott Stringer Sues for Defamation Over Sexual Assault Claim
description: Nearly 20 months after allegations of unwanted sexual advances derailed his campaign for New York City mayor, Scott M. Stringer sued one of his accusers for defamation on Monday, arguing that she smeared his reputation with falsehoods and misrepresentations.

title: Fashion Photography: From Edgy to Excess
description: Helmut Newton and Guy Bourdin revolutionized fashion photography from the late 1960s through the 70s with sexy pictures that were kinky and edgy. They rejected genteel proprieties and posed women with full-frontal nudity, in lesbian seductions, as victims of murder, in bondage restraints and as killers of hapless men. They were implying narratives, much as Richard Avedon had done earlier, but the new back stories were far more transgressive. The photographs shocked and scandalized. In 1975, the Times art critic Hilton Kramer found Newtons pictures to be so clamorous and unsavory that the interest in fashion is indistinguishable from an interest in murder, pornography and terror.

title: How Peter Pan Inspired Richard Branson
description: In the opening moments of the HBO documentary series Branson, Richard Branson looks into the camera to say goodbye.

title: Iran Turns to Public Executions, Enraging an Already Protesting Public
description: After months of protests in Iran that have only escalated as the governments crackdown has turned deadlier, officials have begun publicly executing protesters, including a 23-year-old man who was hanged on Monday from a construction crane, bringing a new wave of outrage from an Iranian public calling for the end of the countrys theocratic regime.

title: Inflation Forecasts Were Wrong Last Year. Should We Believe Them Now?
description: At this time last year, economists were predicting that inflation would swiftly fade in 2022 as supply chain issues cleared, consumers shifted from goods to services spending and pandemic relief waned. They are now forecasting the same thing for 2023, citing many of the same reasons.

title: Police Arrest 18-Year-Old Man After Teen Girl Is Fatally Stabbed in Harlem
description: Police investigators have arrested an 18-year-old man in connection to the death of a 16-year-old girl who was found with a stab wound to her neck inside an apartment building in Harlem just after 5:30 p.m. on Sunday, the police said.

title: Wall Street Journal Names a New Editor
description: The Wall Street Journal named a new top editor on Monday, saying it would hand control of the newsroom to Emma Tucker, a longtime editor for Rupert Murdoch-owned newspapers in Britain. She replaces Matt Murray, who has led the paper for the past four years, occasionally clashing with the papers publisher.

title: Latke Party!
description: Hanukkah is less than a week away. Are you ready to fry?

title: In Harlem, a Playful New Youth Center Is an Instant Landmark
description: The new home of the Brotherhood Sister Sol is an architectural showpiece on a quiet street of old tenements in West Harlem.

title: A Portrait of Rembrandt Goes on Show. But Did He Paint It?
description: THE HAGUE  In 1934, a plumber from Dayton, Ohio, took a weekend trip to New York City and got drunk with some German sailors. When he awoke in the morning, his money was gone, but there were three rolled-up old paintings in his hotel room. One of them looked curiously like a Rembrandt.

title: Samara Joys Voice (and Social Media) Is Helping Jazz Find Fresh Ears
description: Samara Joy was kicking off an encore engagement at New Yorks storied Blue Note club in November, just days before her 23rd birthday, when sparks began to fly.

title: Dating Scammer Who Swindled Women Sentenced to Five Years in Prison
description: According to the personal ads cited in court documents, Patrick Giblin was a deep man; one who didnt judge a woman on her appearance and who was looking for one real, true, genuine woman. She should be ready to commit.

title: Decades After the Central Park Jogger Attack, a City Marks Its Mistake
description: They entered the northeast corner of Central Park one night in 1989 and were later falsely prosecuted for the brutal attack and rape of a woman who was jogging. Now five Black and Latino men, who went to prison as teenagers and spent years behind bars for a crime they did not commit, are being honored by the city, which is renaming a gate to the park for them.

title: In the English Countryside, a Lunch Where Craft Is Front and Center
description: That Suzie de Rohan Willner finds herself living in Wallingford, a handsome market town that sits on Englands river Thames in Oxfordshire, feels like fate. Some 30 years ago, de Rohan Willner, 60, who is the head of the British clothing and homewares brand Toast  known for its simple and hard-working offerings  acquired a print that depicted an idyllic cluster of long boats and riverside dwellings. At the time, she was living in Bagnols-en-Fort in France (though she was born in Surrey, as a child she often visited her grandmother in Roquebrune Cap Martin and went on to study in Paris, later setting up home in Saint-Clment-de-la-Place), but the artwork came with her when she moved to Provence, to West London and, finally, during the lockdown of 2020, to Wallingford. Two months after arriving there with her husband, Stephen Green of the architecture, interiors and landscape design studio Holland Green, and her mother, Joy Mitchell, de Rohan Willner took the picture to be reframed and was informed that it is of the same stretch of river that passes some 300 meters from her new house.

title: Alexandra Pelosi on Filming Her Mother, Nancy Pelosi, During the Jan. 6 Attack
description: The filmmaker Alexandra Pelosi has made 14 documentaries, none more intimate, laborious or destabilizing than her latest. The subject is her mother, Nancy Pelosi.

title: A Gunman Kills 3 in Rome, Shocking the City
description: ROME  It was an apparent act of vengeance that made national news and emblazoned newspaper front pages as much for the rarity as the brutality of the crime.

title: These Soccer and World Cup Movies Have Big Goals
description: Every four years, the World Cup offers something not unlike the movies: For a whole month, it stops time, enveloping its distant spectators in the electric-green glow of the screen.

title: A Fast-Growing Network of Conservative Groups Is Fueling a Surge in Book Bans
description: The Keller Independent School District, just outside of Dallas, passed a new rule in November: It banned books from its libraries that include the concept of gender fluidity.

title: Can Australia Save a Rare Reptile by Moving It to a Cooler Place?
description: Standing knee-deep in a swamp, the researchers plucked three dozen tortoises one by one from cardboard boxes, lowering them into the water. Then they watched as some of Australias most critically endangered reptiles took off into the wetlands, bound for an audacious experiment in climate adaptation.

title: In a Wary Arctic, Norway Starts to See Russian Spies Everywhere
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: U. of Texas Basketball Coach Suspended After Felony Domestic Assault Charge
description: Chris Beard was suspended as the head coach of the University of Texas mens basketball team after he was arrested on a felony domestic violence charge in Austin, Texas, early Monday. The authorities said he had assaulted a member of his household by trying to stop the persons breathing.

title: Major Fusion Energy Breakthrough to Be Announced by Scientists
description: Scientists at a federal nuclear weapons facility have made a potentially significant advance in fusion research that could lead to a source of bountiful energy in the future, according to a government official.

title: Fentanyl Cuts a Bitter Swath Through Milwaukee
description: MILWAUKEE  Glenda O. Hampton doesnt need to look far to witness the devastation of the fentanyl epidemic in her neighborhood on Milwaukees north side.

title: Mass Migrant Crossing Floods Texas Border Facilities
description: EL PASO  After nightfall on Sunday, hundreds of migrants stepped across the Rio Grande and into El Paso, a caravan of people mainly from Nicaragua whose crossing was among the largest in recent years along the West Texas border.

title: China Maps Out Plans to Put Astronauts on the Moon and on Mars
description: JIUQUAN SATELLITE LAUNCH CENTER  Thirty years ago, the Chinese government initiated a secret plan for its space program, including a key goal of building a space station by 2020.

title: Why Some Scientists Choose Chinas Space Station for Research
description: Seeking to burnish its prestige in the world, China is portraying its Tiangong orbital outpost as a space station that is available for scientists everywhere, not just for those who happen to live in other countries with established space programs.

title: A Timeline of Chinas Advancements in Spaceflight
description: China successfully launches its first biological experiment to the edge of space: a rocket carrying eight white mice.

title: The Team That Refuses to Lose
description: DOHA, Qatar  Zlatko Dalic knew that something had to change. Dalic, the coach of Croatia, was just not sure, at that precise moment, exactly what it was. Brazil was starting to ratchet up the pressure, its bright yellow jerseys pouring forward in waves. His Croatia team was scrabbling to repel the attacks. His players, he could see, were barely hanging on.

title: Obstruction Charge Takes Center Stage at Jan. 6 Court Hearing
description: Prosecutors and defense lawyers squared off on Monday at a federal appeals court hearing in Washington over the use of a criminal charge whose viability could affect the cases of hundreds of people indicted in connection with the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol  and could help decide what, if any, charges could ultimately be brought against former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Mariah Careys All I Want for Christmas Is You Returns to No. 1
description: Back in 1994, Mariah Carey released the album Merry Christmas, with an anchor track, All I Want for Christmas Is You, that mixed the R&B production style of the era with nostalgic touches reminiscent of Phil Spector. The song did well at radio, and the album reached No. 3 on Billboards chart, behind LPs from Kenny G and Boyz II Men.

title: Teenagers in The Times: Fall 2022
description: Welcome to a mammoth edition of our Teenagers in The Times feature.

title: Ashley Bickerton, Unflinchingly Honest About His Work and Illness
description: I cant think of another artist who was both brilliant on canvas and on a surfboard, said Paul Theroux, the writer. He was speaking of one of the artists he most admired, Ashley Bickerton, and these words of Therouxs inspired me to plan a trip to his home: If Gauguin had caught some waves in Tahiti then I think wed have an apt comparison.

title: Kyrsten Sinemas Exit From the Democratic Party
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 Fun, Festive Candy Recipes That Are Worth the Effort
description: I wont sugarcoat it: Making candy is tricky.

title: Kindred Review: Octavia Butler Comes to the Screen
description: The hallmark of Octavia E. Butlers beloved novel Kindred is its believability. You may race through the book because its a cleverly constructed and paced science-fiction(-ish) page-turner. But its power comes from Butlers meticulously imagined depiction of the lives of slaves and slave owners in the antebellum South and her rigorous consideration of how a time-traveling contemporary Black woman (circa 1976) might fare in that world. The effectiveness of the fantasy depends on the density of the reality.

title: Cyberattack Hits Brooklyn Hospitals That Serve Poor New Yorkers
description: A Brooklyn hospital group that serves patients in some of New Yorks poorest neighborhoods has been battling the consequences of a cyberattack that forced some critical services offline.

title: Bookforum Is Closing, Leaving Ever Fewer Publications Devoted to Books
description: The literary magazine Bookforum announced on Monday that its current issue would be its last, dealing a significant blow to literary journalism, which has been vastly diminished in recent years.

title: How Sexism Influenced Corporate Governance
description: Early in the 20th century, many owners of the iconic companies of the day were women. Before the 1929 stock market crash, female shareholders outnumbered male shareholders at AT&T, General Electric and the Pennsylvania Railroad (even though the men owned more shares).

title: Golden Globes 2023 Snubs (Will Smith) and Surprises (Brendan Fraser)
description: When it comes to defining an awards shows sensibility, what is omitted is often as telling as what gets recognized.

title: Richmonds Last Confederate Statue Is Removed
description: The last Confederate statue in Richmond, Va., was removed on Monday, and the remains beneath it of Ambrose P. Hill, the Confederate lieutenant general who was memorialized, were set to be transferred to a cemetery, an official said.

title: Two Decades After 9/11 Inquiry, a Similar Plan for Covid Stalls in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  The nation was reeling from an unfathomable number of deaths. Politicians were pointing fingers, asking why the United States had been so ill-prepared for a lethal threat. Congress, defying the White House, ordered an independent investigation.

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Block Californias Ban on Flavored Tobacco
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday refused to block a California law banning flavored tobacco, clearing the way for the ban to take effect next week.

title: Soccer Legends, Arab Viewers and the Man in the Middle

title: E.U. Roiled by Corruption Investigation Linked to Qatar
description: BRUSSELS  As the Belgian authorities broadened their investigation into allegations that European Parliament lawmakers and others may have taken bribes from Qatar, the assemblys president warned on Monday that illegal lobbying posed a major threat to the institution.

description: Instead of running a head-to-head space race against the U.S., China has set off on a marathon. Its making good time.

description: I followed the Academia de Mariachi Nuevo Amanecer, a mariachi school based in Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Where the Skinny Jeans Are

title: The E.U. imposes fresh sanctions on Iranians over supplying drones to Russia.

description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Military Plans New $435 Million Health Facility at Guantnamo Bay

title: F.B.I. Reports Drop in Hate Crimes, but Lack of Data Casts Doubt on Figures
description: WASHINGTON  The federal tally of hate crimes fell in 2021, but the statistics are deeply misleading because scores of police departments across the country, including in New York City and most cities in California, did not submit data.

title: Angelo Badalamenti, Composer for Twin Peaks, Is Dead at 85
description: Angelo Badalamenti, an internationally sought-after composer who wrote the hypnotic theme to Twin Peaks, David Lynchs 1990s television drama series, and the music for five Lynch films, including Blue Velvet (1986), died on Sunday at his home in Lincoln Park, N.J. He was 85.

description: Two organizations quietly spent $32 million in last months midterm elections on organizing meant to combat election denialism and promote voting access, according to a progressive strategist behind the effort.

description: Follow our live coverage of the arrest of FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Project Veritas Says It Provided $20,500 in Excess Benefit to Its Founder
description: WASHINGTON  Project Veritas, the right-wing group known for its sting operations, reported in its latest filing to the I.R.S. that it provided a prohibited excess benefit last year to its founder, James OKeefe.

description: As anger and frustration ripple through the Republican Party over its underwhelming performance in this years midterm elections, Republicans are offering a number of explanations for their losses.

title: Putin Skips Annual News Conference, Avoiding Possible Questions on War
description: It has been an annual ritual of Vladimir V. Putins Russia: The president holds a wide-ranging, marathon news conference in December, making a somewhat choreographed show of openness to questioning and demonstrating his command of an array of topics.

description: Many people love something about Merrily We Roll Along but few people love everything.

description: Lurid tales of class war in paradise were a major cinematic trend in 2022.

description: In early November, just days before the cryptocurrency exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy, its founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, reached out to his archrival, Changpeng Zhao, to ask for help.

title: Louisville to Pay $2 Million to Breonna Taylors Boyfriend, Lawyer Says
description: The city of Louisville, Ky., has agreed to pay $2 million to settle lawsuits brought by the boyfriend of Breonna Taylor, a Black woman who was fatally shot by police officers in 2020 and whose death ignited nationwide protests against police brutality, according to one of his lawyers.

description: Update: Sam Bankman-Fried was released from federal custody on Thursday under bail conditions that include a $250 million bond secured by his parents home.

title: 6 Dead, Including 2 Officers, After Shootout in Rural Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Two police officers and a bystander were killed in a shootout that erupted during an investigation into a missing-person case in the Australian state of Queensland, the police said on Tuesday, with one official describing the officers death as a ruthless execution.

description: Jump to: Tricky Clues | Todays Theme

title: Elusive L.A. Celebrity Is Caught: Theres a Lion in Your Yard
description: LOS ANGELES  The mountain lion had long roamed Los Angeles like an elusive celebrity. Sometimes, he was captured in the grainy footage of a home doorbell; at other times, residents claimed to have come face-to-face with his soulful gaze.

title: Lauren Boebert, Far-Right Firebrand, Wins Re-election After Recount
description: After a recount in a remarkably close race, Representative Lauren Boebert of Colorado, known for heckling President Biden during his State of the Union speech, arming herself on Capitol Hill and ignoring Covid mask rules, won her bid for a second term. Colorados secretary of state, Jena Griswold, announced the results on Monday.

title: New Yorks New Gun Law Remains Intact for Now After Appeals Court Ruling
description: New Yorks new gun law remains intact, at least temporarily, after a federal appeals court on Monday paused a lower courts ruling blocking a key section of the law that bans firearms in parks, in public transit systems and on private property, without the property owners permission.

title: Day 13: For a Celebrated Chef, the Tastes and Smells of St. Lucia Day in Sweden Linger
description: I love the holidays, especially through the lens of food as a chef. I came to Sweden from Ethiopia when I was very young, so while my own holiday traditions started with my adoptive mom and older sisters, I have always been fascinated by how people celebrate throughout the world.

title: Chechen Leader Has More Interactions With U.F.C. Fighters Amid U.S. Sanctions
description: As the war in Ukraine heads into winter, Ramzan Kadyrov, one of the closest allies of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, is gaining more visibility and propagandist fodder through his connections with Ultimate Fighting Championship fighters and others in mixed martial arts.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the disgraced founder of the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, was arrested in the Bahamas yesterday after U.S. prosecutors filed criminal charges. The U.S. is likely to request his extradition, the government of the Bahamas said in a statement. An indictment will be unsealed today, U.S. prosecutors said.

title: A 108-Foot-Tall Cottonwood Thrills the Tree Hunter
description: Good morning. Its Tuesday. Today well meet the tree that an arborist in upstate New York says is the biggest in the state. Well also look at the defamation case filed by Scott Stringer, the former city comptroller whose campaign for mayor sank amid claims of sexual assault from the early 2000s.

description: Where and how you live shapes your households contribution to climate change. Explore differences across the nation.

title: Corrections: Dec. 13, 2022
description: An article on Friday about the booming global market for commercial spyware described incorrectly the snooping technique used by a company Tal Dilian co-founded, Circles. It is Signaling System 7 exploitation, not simply Signaling System 7, which is a signaling protocol.

title: Winter Storm
description: A powerful winter storm system is inching its way across the United States this week. Has your area been hit by heavy snow, rain, ice or wind?

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: There Must Be More Room for Africa, Leader of African Union Says
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Since he took the helm of the African Union, Macky Sall, who is also president of the West African nation of Senegal, has been making the argument that Africa does not have the influence it warrants in world affairs.

title: Brain Implants Have Begun to Restore Functions, but Advances Are Slow
description: A jumble of cords and two devices the size of soda cans protrude from Austin Beggins head when he undergoes testing with a team of researchers studying brain implants that are meant to restore function to those who are paralyzed.

title: Eldest BTS Member, Jin, Enlists in South Korean Army
description: SEOUL  The day that many fans of BTS had hoped would never come has arrived. Jin, the eldest member of the K-pop supergroup, started his military service on Tuesday, fulfilling a pledge that ended a debate about South Koreas mandatory conscription.

title: Blue Room
description: Incarcerated men and women watch nature videos on a loop in a mental health program.

title: Experience the Great Outdoors From Prison
description: Years ago, I read about an exploratory program that showed nature imagery to people in prison. During allotted downtime and in high-stress situations, individuals could request to visit the blue room to watch nature videos. Prison administrators hoped that these sessions would offer alternatives for people who were struggling emotionally, many of whom often ended up in solitary confinement.

title: Its the Wrapping Paper That Counts
description: Melanie Boschaert has one goal for Christmas: I want my children to be special and feel special.

title: What Role Do Libraries Play in Your Life?
description: How often do you go to your school or local public library? What do you use it for?

title: Big Joe the Forklift, and More Ways to Spread Help
description: This article is part of a series recounting the stories of people who received help from nonprofit organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Subway Station Clerks to Step Out From Booths Into New Role
description: Long confined to their metal-and-glass enclosures, booth clerks in the New York City subway will soon roam stations, shedding an obsolete role to engage with riders increasingly frustrated over safety and service.

title: 2022 Review: How Republicans Lost Despite Winning the Popular Vote
description: Heres a figure about the 2022 midterm elections that might surprise you: Republicans won the national House popular vote by three percentage points  51 percent to 48 percent. They still won by two points after adjusting for races in which only one major party was on the ballot.

title: The Rich Get College Subsidies While the Student Debt Debate Goes On
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Republicans Are Breaking With the N.R.A., and Its Because of Us
description: You were right to feel hopeless. Gun safety was a lost cause. The National Rifle Association was invincible, and the Republican Party was never going to defy it. The failure to alter that reality after the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School  10 years ago on Wednesday  choked off our last faint wisp of hope.

title: Biden Signs Bill to Protect Same-Sex Marriage Rights
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden signed the Respect for Marriage Act into law on Tuesday, mandating federal recognition for same-sex marriages and capping his own personal evolution toward embracing gay rights over the course of a four-decade political career.

title: Justice Dept. Considers Early Release for Female Inmates Sexually Abused Behind Bars
description: WASHINGTON  The epidemic of sexual assaults against female prisoners in federal custody has prompted the Justice Department to expand the use of a program to provide early releases to women abused behind bars, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Why Do Men Sprout Hairs in Weird Places With Age?
description: Q: Im a man in my 50s and have noticed hair sprouting in weird places like the tops and insides of my ears and in my nose. Is this normal? Why does it happen? How can I get rid of it?

title: Hochuls Big Choice: Picking New Yorks Most Powerful Judge
description: Gov. Kathy Hochuls impending selection of a new chief judge for New Yorks highest court has become a political test, thanks to simmering discontent among state Democratic lawmakers over the courts leadership, and as state judges around the country are poised to play bigger roles in resolving questions of fundamental rights.

title: Scientists Achieve Nuclear Fusion Breakthrough With Blast of 192 Lasers
description: Scientists studying fusion energy at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory in California announced on Tuesday that they had crossed a long-awaited milestone in reproducing the power of the sun in a laboratory.

title: A Manual for Ear-Cleaning Women
description: Once a week when I was small, my mother would clean the wax from my ears with a silver bobby pin; I always felt woozy afterward in a rare way I still crave. Leen, the center and most-of-the-time narrator of Jamie Marina Laus second novel, Gunk Baby, recalls being similarly hooked on the delirium she felt in childhood when her mother would scoop out her ears each night with metal rods. Although the cleanings left her euphoric, she grew anxious throughout each day about what unseen crap was building up inside her. Addictive, she thinks: What you cant see, you trust someone else to be able to somehow.

title: Cheap Meets Eco-Chic on the Ski Slopes
description: Around the time the first flurries of snow begin to dust the slopes in Aspen, Colo., Amiee White Beazley, a writer and mother of two teenagers based in nearby Basalt, hits the areas annual ski swap, a fall pop-up sale for used and discounted snow apparel and gear with a festival feel.

title: Time Is Way Weirder Than You Think
description: Its not an exaggeration to say that clock time runs our lives. From the moment our alarms go off in the morning, the clock reigns supreme: our meetings, our appointments, even our social plans are often timed down to the minute. We even measure the quality of our lives with reference to time, often lamenting that time seems to fly by when were having fun and drags on when were bored or stagnant. We rarely stop to think about time, but thats precisely because there are few forces more omnipresent in our lives.

title: Misty Copelands Tribute to Her Mentor, and Other Memoirs
description: Elegant, determined, courageous  these are words Misty Copeland, the first Black female principal dancer with American Ballet Theater, uses to describe Raven Wilkinson, one of the first Black ballerinas to sign a contract with a major company, in 1955. They also describe THE WIND AT MY BACK: Resilience, Grace, and Other Gifts From My Mentor, Raven Wilkinson (225 pp., Grand Central, $29), written with Susan Fales-Hill, which recounts Wilkinsons hard-won entry into the ultra-white world of ballet amid racial segregation in the United States, and Copelands own racialized battles in the same world five decades later.

title: The Tatami Galaxy Traps You in a Time Loop of Self-Pity
description: The nameless narrator of Tomihiko Morimis The Tatami Galaxy has four chances to introduce himself. Every time, the wreckage is identical: a college junior, living in filth, mourning two years of idle misanthropy. He arrived at Kyoto University intending to associate wholesomely with members of the opposite sex, to devote myself to my studies, to temper my flesh. He has instead developed expertise only in eating cake, reading smut and pranking his enviably alive peers. How the hell did you end up like this? Youve come so far, and this is all you amount to? he rages at his mirrored reflection. We read this rage four times, verbatim, as this is a novel of alternate histories. A chance encounter with a minor god has opened up a time loop for our narrator. Granted a precious opportunity to redo his squandered youth, he sets out to attain the rose-colored campus life he once envisioned for himself.

title: Are Qatars World Cup Stadiums the Future of Sports in a Warming World?
description: DOHA, Qatar  Saud Ghani knows cool.

title: As Covid Spreads Fast, Beijing Isnt in Lockdown. But It Feels Like It.
description: Restaurants have closed because too many staff members have tested positive for Covid. The usually ubiquitous food delivery workers zipping through traffic on their scooters have nearly vanished because of infections. Pharmacies have been emptied of cold medicine, and supermarkets have been running low on the essentials such as disinfectant solution and antibacterial wipes.

title: Inflation Cooled Notably in November, Good News for the Fed
description: Inflation slowed more sharply than expected in November, an encouraging sign for both Federal Reserve officials and consumers that 18 months of rapid and unrelenting price increases are beginning to meaningfully abate.

title: Stocks edge higher as early rally fades.
description: Stocks rose on Tuesday after a softer-than-expected inflation report for November cemented expectations that the Federal Reserve could slow its campaign to raise interest rates, which has weighed heavily on stock prices.

title: Dubai Has More Restaurants Per Capita Than New York. Whats on the Menu?
description: In mid-September, on an artificial, palm tree-shaped island in the Persian Gulf, an avant-garde dinner service  performance is a better word  kicked off around 6 p.m. in a dimly lit restaurant on the roof of Dubais Nakheel Mall. Outside, the twilight call to prayer echoed off skyscrapers, construction sites and neighborhoods filled with low white villas.

title: The Best Cookbooks of 2022
description: Few things delight quite like sitting down on the couch with a newly purchased cookbook, giving the spine a good crack and thumbing through those glossy, yet-to-be-sauce-splattered pages. But when hundreds of cookbooks publish every year, the opportunities for culinary wonder can feel endless. Where does one begin? At The New York Times Food desk, with a color-coded spreadsheet and an appetite, of course. Our staff read and tested dozens of books in our annual search for the most compelling stories, the sharpest cooking instruction and the most mouthwatering recipes. These 16 books managed to transport, teach and entice in ways that distinguished them from the pack  and to convince us that yes, theres always room for one more title on the shelf. TANYA SICHYNSKY

title: For U.S. Museums With Looted Art, the Indiana Jones Era Is Over
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Disruptive, or Depressed? Psychiatrists Reach Out to Teens of Color
description: ATLANTA  Dr. Brittany Stallworth was in fifth grade when she received her first suspension. She and four girlfriends had worn lime-green shirts to school to celebrate the birthday of one of the girls, whose favorite color was green.

title: Israelis Have Put Benjamin Netanyahu Back in Power. Palestinians Will Surely Pay the Price.
description: HAIFA, Israel  As the prime minister-designate, Benjamin Netanyahu, finalizes the formation of Israels most extreme right-wing government to date, I, along with other Palestinians in Israel and in the occupied territories, am filled with dread about what the next few years will bring.

title: Film Club: What Happens to the Migrant Workers Who Built the World Cup?
description: Note to teachers: This will be the last Film Club of the year. Film Club will resume on Tuesday, Jan. 10, 2023.

title: The Far-Right Plot to Overthrow the German Government
description: Three thousand security officers fanned out across Germany this past week, raiding 150 homes, arresting 25 people and putting more than 50 others under investigation for plotting to overthrow the national government in Berlin.

title: United Airlines Orders 100 Wide-Body Boeing 787 Jets
description: United Airlines plans to buy at least 100 Boeing 787 Dreamliner jets by 2032 as it replaces aging planes with newer, more fuel-efficient models and pursues international growth, the airline announced on Tuesday.

title: The Power of History
description: If you watched all of the 21 previous mens World Cups, you would see winners and runners-up from only two continents: Europe and South America.

title: S.E.C. Charges Sam Bankman-Fried With Defrauding FTX Investors
description: U.S. regulators filed civil securities fraud charges on Tuesday against Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the collapsed FTX crypto exchange, who was arrested on Monday night at his home in the Bahamas.

title: Indian and Chinese Soldiers Again Trade Blows at Disputed Border
description: Indian and Chinese troops wielding fists, clubs and stun guns have again clashed in a disputed border territory, injuring several soldiers on each side and showing that tensions have not been extinguished after a deadly confrontation more than two years ago.

title: Sam Bankman-Frieds House of Cards Teeters
description: The spectacular rise and fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the failed crypto exchange FTX, came full circle on Monday, with his arrest in the Bahamas at the request of U.S. authorities, followed by the S.E.C. filing its own charges on Tuesday.

title: A Conversation With Eric Garcetti, Who Led Los Angeles for Nearly a Decade
description: LOS ANGELES  On a chilly morning last week in Chinatown, a semicircle of cameras clicked around Eric Garcetti as grinning supporters lined up to shake his hand.

title: Somalis Are Dying of Hunger. Officials Say Its Not a Famine. Why?
description: BAIDOA, Somalia  In drought-ravaged Somalia, where the starving are streaming into giant refugee camps, it looks like a famine.

title: Why Do Stanford, Harvard and NASA Still Honor a Nazi Past?
description: This year, Harvard unveiled a report on the universitys history of profiting from slavery. I believe we bear a moral responsibility to do what we can to address the persistent corrosive effects of those historical practices on individuals, on Harvard and on our society, Lawrence Bacow, the university president, wrote in an open letter to the community. The study was heralded as a long overdue reckoning by an elite institution with its dark past.

title: The Year In Illustration
description: The most memorable New York Times illustrations of 2022

title: Europe Reaches Deal for Carbon Tax Law on Imports
description: The European Union has taken a step closer to adopting a groundbreaking carbon tax law that would impose a tariff on imports from countries that fail to take strict steps to curb their greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Tornado Sweeps Through New Orleans as Death Toll From Storms Reaches 3
description: Tornadoes continued to sweep across the South on Wednesday, killing one person west of New Orleans and leaving scattered damage near the Crescent City, one day after a series of ferocious storms left two others in Louisiana dead and dozens injured.

title: Banksys works near Kyiv have inspired Ukraine. But did one activist go too far?
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Many Ukrainians saw messages of defiance and resilience in the seven artworks painted last month by Banksy, the British street artist, on war-ravaged buildings in and around Kyiv.

title: SZA Revels in Mixed Emotions on SOS
description: I just want whats mine, SZA announces in SOS, the title song and opener of her second studio album. She spends the rest of the album wrestling with exactly what that means. Does she want casual sex or lasting love, relationships or independence, revenge or forgiveness, self-questioning or self-respect, familiar problems or a new start, power or trust? SZAs music melts down styles  singing, rapping, rock, R&B, pop, folk, indie-rock, electronica  to ponder and interrogate her conflicting impulses. And she juggles them all against the backdrop of her career and the demands of celebrity and of social media, where she regularly galvanizes her fans with teasers and snippets.

title: Concern Grows in Israels Military as Netanyahu Nears Coalition Deal
description: JERUSALEM  When a serving Israeli soldier expressed his approval last month of a far-right politician who is set to become a minister in Benjamin Netanyahus likely new coalition government, it set off a national furor.

title: Don Lewis, Unsung Pioneer of Electronic Music, Dies at 81
description: It was 1974, and Don Lewis was getting tired of hauling around so many keyboards. One day he would be in a studio in Los Angeles, working alongside Quincy Jones. A week later, he might be on tour as a member of the Beach Boys backup band. Or he might be performing his own gigs, shuffling up and down the West Coast with an ever-growing assortment of keyboards and other equipment.

title: Tony Awards to Be Staged in Manhattans Washington Heights
description: After 75 years of ceremonies in and around New Yorks theater district, the Tony Awards next year will move uptown, holding the annual best-of-Broadway awards ceremony in Washington Heights.

title: Belarus says it is checking its armys combat readiness. Analysts see little chance it will join Russias fight.
description: Belarus said on Tuesday that its army was assessing its combat readiness, a move that comes as the country has faced pressure to provide further support for Russias forces in Ukraine.

title: Who is John J. Ray III, FTXs new chief executive?
description: John Jay Ray III, a lawyer who specializes in restructuring troubled companies, has helped to manage the fallout from some of the largest corporate failures in history, including the implosion of the energy trading firm Enron after an accounting scandal in 2001.

title: The slowdown in inflation was driven by food, energy and used vehicles.
South Africas Parliament Rejects Impeachment Inquiry of President
description: JOHANNESBURG  Lawmakers from South Africas governing African National Congress put their weight behind President Cyril Ramaphosa on Tuesday, rejecting an effort to proceed with an impeachment inquiry over accusations that he broke the law in his response to the theft of a large sum of U.S. currency from his farm.

title: Colorado Third Congressional District Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the 2022 Colorado elections.

title: The Arctic Is Becoming Wetter and Stormier, Scientists Warn
description: As humans warm the planet, the once reliably frigid and frozen Arctic is becoming wetter and stormier, with shifts in its climate and seasons that are forcing local communities, wildlife and ecosystems to adapt, scientists said Tuesday in an annual assessment of the region.

title: Black Travelers Say Home-Share Hosts Discriminate, and a New Airbnb Report Agrees
description: Home-sharing services like Airbnb and Vrbo market themselves as platforms for sharing, community and joy. Their advertisements show guests of varying ethnic backgrounds gathering happily in sunny houses, seeming to feel at home  or even better, on vacation.

title: Prosecutors Say FTX Was Engaged in a Massive, Yearslong Fraud
description: Sam Bankman-Frieds lies, prosecutors say, stretched back to the very beginning.

title: Here is the criminal indictment against Sam Bankman-Fried
description: The indictment charges Mr. Bankman-Fried with eight counts, including wire fraud on customers and lenders and conspiracy to defraud the United States and violate campaign finance laws, among other charges.

title: An Iconic Album, and Gender Identity Today
description: To the Editor:

title: Read the Criminal Indictment Against Sam Bankman-Fried
description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan unsealed an eight count indictment against Sam Bankman-Fried on Tuesday morning, a day after the crypto entrepreneur was arrested in the Bahamas.

title: In Libya, Mystery Shrouds Handover of Lockerbie Suspect to U.S.
description: The transfer of a Libyan suspect to the United States to stand trial in the 1988 Lockerbie airliner bombing has stoked tensions in Libya, where some in the divided country saw the handover, under murky circumstances, as an abduction rather than an extradition.

title: Can Fusion Solve the Climate Crisis?
description: The news this week that scientists had achieved a breakthrough in fusion technology was hailed as a milestone on the path toward a future of nearly limitless, emissions-free power.

title: Violence Spreads Through Peru in Days After Its Presidents Ouster
description: LIMA, Peru A relatively peaceful, if abrupt, transfer of presidential power in Peru last week has shifted into violence and unrest as supporters of the former president intensified claims that his ouster was illegitimate and have staged attacks against police stations, courthouses, factories, airports and a military base.

title: French Court Convicts 8 of Aiding 2016 Terrorist Attack in Nice
description: A French court on Tuesday found eight defendants guilty of aiding in the terrorist attack that killed 86 people in the Mediterranean city of Nice in 2016, after a trial that offered some closure to survivors and the bereaved but did little to clarify the motives behind the massacre.

title: The judge in the Bankman-Fried case is part of a local legal clan.
description: The Manhattan judge who will oversee Sam Bankman-Frieds case is Ronnie Abrams, who comes from a family of legal renown.

title: Severe Storms Damage Homes in North Texas
description: The storms spawned several tornadoes on Tuesday, including one near Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport.

title: Mike Leach, Football Coach With an Air Raid Offense, Dies at 61
description: Mike Leach, a quirky, blunt-spoken head coach at three universities who commanded an audacious, high-powered, pass-happy Air Raid offense, which influenced other colleges and N.F.L. teams, died on Monday in Jackson, Miss. He was 61.

title: As Morocco and France Prepare to Play, Decades of History Collide
description: PARIS  Saturday night was both exhilarating and confusing for Anas Daif. Morocco and France had just advanced to the World Cup semifinals, setting the stage for a showdown on Wednesday, and Daif couldnt decide which team to support  his country of descent or his country of birth.

title: Hey Silicon Valley, Maybe Its Time to Dress Up, Not Down
description: The mythic figure that is the billionaire tech genius in the nowhere man tee may finally be about to meet its long overdue end. The arrest of Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the FTX cryptocurrency trading platform, on Monday in the Bahamas on charges of fraud, may signal not just the next stage in his downfall, but also a change in the global image-making of Silicon Valley.

title: Geminid Meteor Shower: How and When to Watch It Peak
description: Tuesday night into Wednesday morning will be one of the special dates scattered throughout each year when skywatchers can catch a meteor shower as a multitude of flares potentially burst in the darkness.

title: Adam Sandler to Receive Mark Twain Prize for American Humor
description: Adam Sandler has had a busy 2022: He starred as a basketball scout in a critically acclaimed performance in the Netflix sports drama Hustle; he won an honorary Gotham Award, giving a speech that brought the house down; and undertook his first nationwide arena tour in three years. Now, hell be able to start off 2023 with at least one sure thing: a comedy prize.

title: Where to Buy Cheap Trussardi in Rome (For a Good Cause)
description: ROME  As far as fashion store openings go, it was a low-key affair. There were no celebrities, no Champagne, not even a representative from Trussardi, the luxury Italian brand that had supplied the store with its merchandise.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Dean Buonomano
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Dean Buonomano. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: An Ancient Horizon Calendar Comes Into View Over Mexico City
description: Long before Europeans colonized North America, the Indigenous peoples in the valley where Mexico City would later arise may have followed a natural solar calendar that was so accurate it accounted for leap years.

title: What are the symptoms of an infection with BQ.1 and BQ.1.1?
description: Two new iterations of the Omicron variant have found their way to the top of the list of Covid subvariants circulating in the U.S. BQ.1.1 and BQ.1 now together account for nearly 70 percent of cases in the U.S., according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  squeezing out BA.5, which was dominant over the summer.

title: Texas Clamps Down on Border in El Paso
description: EL PASO  Officials in Texas took steps on Tuesday to all but close an international crossing in El Paso, as state police began conducting commercial vehicle inspections of trucks entering the United States.

title: Do boosters and prior infections protect against BQ.1 and BQ.1.1?
description: If you were infected with a previous version of Omicron recently, you can still become reinfected with BQ.1 and BQ.1.1, said Dr. Peter Chin-Hong, an infectious disease specialist at the University of California, San Francisco. However, a previous infection does confer some additional protection, he added  but that protection is unlikely to last beyond three months.

title: What should I watch out for if Im worried about Paxlovid rebound?
description: Reports of Paxlovid rebound popped up in the spring of 2022, as some people who had taken the antiviral medication experienced a recurrence of Covid symptoms, days after their infection appeared to have cleared up. But that rebound effect isnt limited to people who have taken Paxlovid: a study this past fall found that symptoms can flare up again even in people who did not take the antiviral medication.

title: Its Time to Wear a Mask Again, Health Experts Say
description: Masks are back, and, this time, theyre not just for Covid-19. A tripledemic of the coronavirus, influenza and respiratory syncytial virus, known as R.S.V., sweeping through the United States has prompted several cities and counties, including New York City and Los Angeles County, to encourage people to wear a mask in indoor public spaces once again.

title: Ixta, Serving Mexican Food With an Eye to Tulum, Opens on the Bowery
description: What was Daniel Bouluds modern kitchen and bar, adorned with French copper cookware, now pays homage to Mexico, specifically Tulum, the popular Yucatn destination. (Tulum is big this week; see below.) An elaborately decorated fantasyland with 165 seats, Ixta is the restaurateur Mike Himanis largest undertaking to date. He and his partners say that they were also inspired by Oaxaca, and theyre certainly on target with an emphasis on mezcals. But the food, by the chef Francisco Blanco, who worked at Le Cirque, is more generally Mexican, with lots of contemporary touches, and long on seafood. Raw bar items, including ceviches, head the menu, which also lists a smoked salmon corn crisp, Caesar salad, a few tacos, whole branzino, halibut in a banana leaf and a whole suckling pig.

title: Massive Fire Burns Down Part of an N.Y.P.D. Evidence Center in Brooklyn
description: A raging three-alarm fire at a New York Police Department facility that holds seized vehicles and evidence including DNA from cold cases sent large plumes of smoke billowing across the Red Hook neighborhood of Brooklyn on Tuesday, as officials sought to determine how many pending criminal cases would be affected.

title: Do You Have Covid, Flu or R.S.V.?
description: Three different viruses are sending children and adults to hospital emergency rooms across the United States this winter. Not only is the coronavirus making a comeback because of new immune-evasive variants, but influenza and the respiratory syncytial virus are also spreading earlier than usual and at record rates.

title: In Seattle, a Lake House Thats All About the Views
description: The home had still had its original knob-and-tube wiring. But they were willing to overlook a few shortcomings.

title: The House Was in Bad Shape. But It Was on a Lake in Seattle.
description: Finding a home that feels right isnt easy. Sometimes, as Jeremy and Jen Lewis discovered while hunting for a place in Seattle, it can take years.

title: Britains Leader Unveils Tough Plans to Tackle Illegal Crossings by Migrant Boats
description: LONDON  Under growing pressure to curb the arrival of migrants in small boats on the English coast, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Tuesday announced plans to tackle Britains big backlog in asylum claims and to fast-track the return of most Albanians seeking refugee status.

title: Is This the End of Peace Through Trade?
description: In the early 20th century the British author Norman Angell published a famous book titled The Great Illusion, which declared that economic progress and growing world trade had made war obsolete. Nations, he argued, could no longer enrich themselves through conquest: Industrial workers couldnt be exploited like peasants, and even small nations could prosper by importing raw materials and selling their wares on world markets. Furthermore, war between economically interdependent nations would be immensely costly even to the victors.

title: The 12 Republican Senators Who Voted for the Same-Sex Marriage Law
description: WASHINGTON  Three of them are retiring from Congress. One has a gay son. One followed the lead of his church, and others said they were concerned primarily with religious liberty protections.

title: Despite Modest G.O.P. Gains, Democrats Maintain Grasp on Suburbs
description: MARIETTA, Ga.  Suburban voters famously rejected Donald J. Trump twice, first by handing Democrats a congressional majority in 2018, then by largely paving the road to the White House for President Biden in 2020.

title: FTX Chief: Company Appeared to Use Old-Fashioned Embezzlement
description: The new chief executive of FTX answered questions about his efforts to recover customer funds from the collapsed crypto exchange during a lengthy hearing before lawmakers on Tuesday, saying his team had encountered an unprecedented lack of record keeping at the company.

title: Whats the Point of Teaching Cursive?
description: Its quaint to read how common it was in the late 1920s, when sound had just come to the movies, to assume it was just a fad. More than a few people thought films had been better without sound  that actors had been more expressive, that sound was intrusive upon the artistic illusion and so on.

title: Tiny Love Stories: I Decided to Be Brutally Honest
description: I had just returned from six months of rehab. Sober for the first time, I wanted to make the holidays special. My children wanted one thing: a Christmas card like those they had received from friends and family during my drunken years. Out of work and broke, I had to be creative. We went to TJ Maxx and picked out festive outfits that I couldnt afford. We tried them on in the dressing room just long enough to snap our Christmas photo. My childrens smiles are proof enough that money doesnt buy happiness. But, for us, sobriety sure does.  Suzanne Hayes

title: Is There a New Covid Divide? Tell Us.
description: Many Americans who once practiced Covid-19 precautions dropped them over the last year after the peak of the Omicron wave passed, or even before it hit. But there are people who continue to wear masks indoors and avoid work or social gatherings, because of underlying health conditions, family dynamics or personal preferences.

title: The Twin Peaks Theme Isnt Just a Song. Its a Portal.
description: Suffering from a case of middle age, I recently decided to learn the piano as an adult. The lesson I played on Monday was the theme from Twin Peaks  well, the idiot-proof, one-hand version that my iPad teaching app prepared for me, built around that low, hypnotic pattern. Bum bommm. Bum BOMMM.

title: The Top Inexpensive New York Restaurants of 2022
description: I loved a lot of restaurants in 2022. Here are some where a normal person can eat an astoundingly good meal for about $10. An abnormal person, by which I mean anyone who orders the way I do, might spend twice as much. It will be worth it.

title: New York Citys Top 7 Dishes of 2022
description: Here, in no special order, is a years worth of memorable dishes I ate around New York. All come from places that did not make my list of 10 favorite restaurants:

title: New Yorks Top 10 New Restaurants of 2022
description: Are we back to normal?

title: Fusion? Weve Seen This Movie Before.
description: Today we step into the future. And it looks a lot like a movie weve all seen.

title: Targeting One Southern City, Ukraine Hints at Next Front in the War
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Ukraine is stepping up efforts to isolate and degrade Russian forces in and around the strategically vital city of Melitopol, ahead of what is widely expected to be the next major phase of the war, a Ukrainian offensive to drive Russian forces from southern Ukraine.

title: Prince Accused of Plot in Germany Is Said to Have Visited Russian Diplomats
description: BERLIN  The German prince accused of organizing a plot to overthrow the German government met at least once with Russian diplomats at a consulate in Germany, according to two people familiar with the investigation into the conspiracy, a meeting that investigators are examining to determine how aggressively the prince tried to involve Moscow in the plot.

title: The Maestro Conducts, and the Band Plays the Hits
description: LUSAIL, Qatar  His arms aloft, Lionel Messi stood before those who had come to adore him. In that second, he had the massed ranks of Argentinas fans inside the Lusail Stadium under his spell. They did not bounce and writhe in celebration. Instead, he held them perfectly still, caught in a moment of quiet communion between the divine and his congregation.

title: Reclaiming a Place in Animation History for a Female Pioneer
description: The pioneers of hand-drawn animation were all men  or at least that is what historians (men, almost exclusively) have long told us.

title: Argentina Heads to Its Sixth World Cup Final
description: Only three other nations have advanced to as many World Cup finals as Argentina, which reached its sixth by beating Croatia, 3-0, in a romp that conferred upon Lionel Messi an ultimate, glorious chance for immortality.

title: The Holiday Edition
description: Last week, I put a call out to Where to Eat readers for holiday-themed questions. You didnt disappoint, sending in a fun mix of dining inquiries. One reader wanted to know which bars and restaurants have the best holiday decorations; another was looking for a special holiday meal before Christmas Day. There was also a pressing question from a reader whos going to the Manhattan Marriage Bureau  colloquially known as a City Hall wedding  in a few weeks and wants to grab a bite after saying, I do. (Not exactly holiday-themed, but I had to help.)

title: Car Design Changes Made Overtaking More Common in Formula 1
description: This year was the first season of Formula 1s updated technical rules, which had the potential to shake up the competitive order as teams made big changes to their cars.

title: Trump Organization Was Held in Contempt After Secret Trial Last Year
description: Donald J. Trumps family business lost a criminal contempt trial that was held in secret last fall, according to a newly unsealed court document and several people with knowledge of the matter, with a judge ruling against the company almost exactly a year before it was convicted of a tax fraud scheme last week.

title: Musk Shakes Up Twitters Legal Team as He Looks to Cut More Costs
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the past two weeks, Elon Musk has shaken up Twitters legal department, disbanded a council that advised the social media company on safety issues and is continuing to take drastic steps to cut costs.

title: Curt Simmons, Last of the Phillies Whiz Kids, Dies at 93
description: Curt Simmons, a pitcher who helped propel the 1950 Philadelphia Phillies to the franchises first pennant in 35 years and went on to become one of baseballs leading left-handers in his 20 major league seasons, died on Tuesday at his home in Ambler, Pa. He was 93.

title: Mastermind of Tax Scheme Sentenced to Eight Years in Prison
description: A lawyer described by the authorities as the brains behind a sprawling tax scheme that cost European treasuries some $60 billion was sentenced to eight years in prison on Tuesday in a courtroom in Bonn, Germany.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: A Nuclear Fusion Breakthrough
description: Scientists studying nuclear fusion in California announced a major breakthrough yesterday. For the first time, a fusion reaction in a lab produced more energy than it took to start the reaction.

title: Theres No Way to Do a Good Job if Youre Judging the Character
description: The actor K. Todd Freeman has worked with Steppenwolf Theater since 1993. His roles, however challenging, usually dont exact a personal toll. Bruce Norriss incendiary Downstate, which debuted at that Chicago theater in 2018, is different.

title: Pelosi in the House Review: Keeping Her House in Order
description: For Pelosi in the House, the documentarian Alexandra Pelosi had what is surely unprecedented access to film her mother, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. But that didnt necessarily make things easy. Youre a tough nut to crack, Alexandra says about half an hour in, noting that Nancy is always on message. If thats what you want to do, the speaker replies. Crack your mom.

title: Podcast Helps Free Two Men Serving Life in Prison for Murder
description: Two Georgia men who were sentenced to life in prison in the 1996 shooting death of their friend were freed last week after a true-crime podcast helped to uncover evidence of police misconduct in their cases, lawyers for both men said.

title: Lloyd Newman, Teenage Chronicler of Ghetto Life, Dies at 43
description: Lloyd Newman, who teamed up with a fellow teenager in the 1990s to record two award-winning radio documentaries that bared the pernicious underside of growing up in a Chicago public housing project, died on Dec. 7 in Elmhurst, Ill. He was 43.

title: As Regents Ready U.C.L.A. Decision, Emails Show Little Public Support
description: Within hours of the stunning news last summer that U.C.L.A. was bolting the Pac-12 Conference, along with the University of Southern California, for a rich Big Ten media contract, emails began peppering the inbox of U.C.L.A.s athletic director, Martin Jarmond.

title: N.Y.U. Students Party at Beloved Barbershop
description: Astor Place Hairstylists, the venerable barbershop that has stood in the East Village of Manhattan for about 75 years, almost closed during the pandemic. Not only has it survived, but the buzzing of clippers is now joined once a month by DJs who turn the 10,000 square-foot basement into a dance club.

title: Prosecutor in Bankman-Fried Case Made a Career of White-Collar Cases
description: Damian Williams, the federal prosecutor overseeing the case of Samuel Bankman-Fried, has been in office only 14 months but he has already handled a series of white-collar prosecutions. When a reporter asked at a news conference on Tuesday where the new case ranked in a district that had prosecuted people like Bernard Madoff, the infamous Ponzi schemer, Mr. Williams said it was hard to compare.

title: Biden Hosts African Leaders for Talks on Security, Trade and Outer Space
description: Follow our live coverage of Bidens summit with African leaders.

title: Bankman-Fried is denied bail by a judge in the Bahamas.
description: In his short career as a cryptocurrency mogul, Sam Bankman-Fried walked the halls of power in Washington, testifying in front of Congress and courting officials at the White House.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Are You Ready for Dresses Over Jeans Again?
description: To some, the early 2000s were a fashion fever dream. Juicy Couture tracksuits. Hoodies under blazers. Wrists crowded with rainbow rubber bracelets. Graphic tees, vests, V-necks and thin scarves. Unironic fedoras. Double denim (or all denim everything,  la Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake). The list goes on.

title: Biden Signs Same-Sex Marriage Equality Bill Into Law
description: The Respect for Marriage Act, which passed Congress with bipartisan support, mandates federal recognition for same-sex and interracial marriages.

title: Why One World Trade Is Winning R.T.O.
description: The tower, next to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum, is doing something right; it's at 94 percent occupancy.

title: Heres What to Know About Tory Lanez and Megan Thee Stallion
description: LOS ANGELES  When Megan Thee Stallion, the Grammy-winning rapper, took the stand this month during the assault trial against the rapper Tory Lanez, she testified that she had received death threats on social media and still had nerve damage after he shot her in the feet in the wake of an argument two years ago.

title: Despite Trumps Lobbying, McCarthys Speaker Bid Remains Imperiled on the Right
description: WASHINGTON  Former President Donald J. Trump has been working the phones, personally pitching right-wing lawmakers on voting to make Representative Kevin McCarthy, the Republican leader he has called My Kevin, the speaker of the House.

title: Sinemas Defection Gives Democrats More Heartburn Over the 2024 Senate Map
description: When Senator Kyrsten Sinema left the Democratic Party last week, she didnt just momentarily drive up antacid sales on Capitol Hill. She also raised the pressure on three especially vulnerable Democratic senators who are up for re-election in 2024, and are defending seats in states that have turned a shade of deep crimson since they were first elected to Congress.

title: Evil Clowns and Cowardly Lions
description: We live in a time when the people who are in charge are scared of the people who arent. Professors report being terrified of their students. Publishing executives fear the wrath of junior employees. C.E.O.s worry about staff revolts. Museum curators watch what they say lest it lead to professional annihilation. Politicians in senior positions are nervous about the newbies  on their own side.

title: Which Party Controls the Pennsylvania House? Its TBD.
description: More than a month after the elections in Pennsylvania, which were among the most closely watched in the country, a question remains unanswered in the states House of Representatives: Who, exactly, is in charge?

title: Scientists Overlooked the Snake Clitoris, Until Now
description: Youve probably seen a snakes forked tongue, but its not the slithering animals only forked body part. Male snakes sport forked genitals called hemipenes that look a bit like pink cactuses and often have spines to match.

title: Joy and Anxiety as Moroccans Look to World Cup Match With France
description: KSAR EL KEBIR, Morocco  Ahead of the World Cup semifinal between Morocco and France on Wednesday, the flip side of Moroccans euphoria at having made it this far in the tournament was excruciating stress.

title: Stuart Margolin, Emmy Winner for The Rockford Files, Dies at 82
description: Stuart Margolin, a character actor best known for playing the sidekick to James Garners private detective on the hit series The Rockford Files, a role that won Mr. Margolin back-to-back Emmy Awards as best supporting actor in 1979 and 1980, died on Monday in Staunton, Va. He was 82.

title: Plan for More Donors and Faster Aid Yields $1 Billion for Ukraine Repairs
description: PARIS  World leaders on Tuesday announced more than $1 billion in swift aid for Ukraine to repair vital infrastructure and survive what is already a brutal winter, at a meeting that was notable as much for the breadth of nations involved as for the scale of their commitments.

title: U.S. Poised to Send Patriot Missiles to Ukraine, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is poised to approve sending its most advanced ground-based air defense system to Ukraine, responding to the countrys urgent request to help defend against an onslaught of Russian missile and drone attacks, two U.S. officials said on Tuesday.

title: Hawaii Volcanoes Mauna Loa and Kilauea Stop Erupting
description: Mauna Loa in Hawaii, the worlds largest active volcano, which began erupting recently for the first time in nearly four decades to the delight of residents and tourists alike, has ceased doing so, scientists announced on Tuesday.

title: Could the B.Q.E. Return to Six Lanes of Traffic?
description: After years of public debate over how to fix the traffic nightmare that is the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway, New Yorkers could end up with something like what they had before: a six-lane highway.

title: Corrections: Dec. 14, 2022
description: An article on Tuesday about Irans public execution of protesters misstated the location of the city of Mashhad. It is in northeastern Iran, not northwestern Iran.

title: Something You Need to Do to Solve Crosswords
description: Jump to: Tricky Clues | Todays Theme

title: Quotation of the Day: Inflation Slows, Leading to Hope of Soft Landing
description: Theyre going to be very cautious: Theyve had their fingers burned.

title: Day 14: Your Guide to Getting Through Gifting Season (Relatively) Stress-Free
description: The holiday season can bring up all kinds of thorny questions: Is it OK to make a wish list? If someone gave you a gift, are you obligated to give them one in return? Why does giving cash often feel weird but giving a gift card does not? Even as someone who loves to gift, I often find myself puzzling over a question of festive etiquette or present protocol this time of year. Luckily for me, the reporter Ali Trachta talked to a slew of experts to get answers to these and other tricky gift-related questions. (And if youre in need of gift ideas for a particular person in your life, the editors of The Times and Wirecutter have put together a comprehensive guide, and a list of great last-minute options, to help with that, too.)

title: The Lions Are Finally Playing Up to Their Coachs Tough-Guy Image
description: Dan Campbell is practically a caricature of a football coach.

title: Long Covid Has Played Role in More Than 3,500 Deaths in U.S., C.D.C. Says
description: Long Covid has caused or contributed to at least 3,500 deaths in the United States, an analysis of death certificates by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found.

title: Why Police Officers Are Leaving: Low Pay, Overwork and High Costs
description: Good morning. Its Wednesday. Well look at why police officers are leaving New York in significant numbers.

title: Winter Storm Brings Heavy Snow to Plains and Upper Midwest
description: The storm brought harsh conditions to the middle of the country.

title: Morocco Has Given the Arab World Something to Cheer for Again
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Moroccos stunning performance in the World Cup, its progress to a semifinal game with France and the worldwide elation it has engendered captures a special moment for Moroccans and many others from the Arab world and beyond.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Scientists studying fusion energy at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory in California announced yesterday that they had crossed a long-awaited milestone in reproducing the power of the sun in a laboratory. It is the first fusion reaction in a laboratory setting that produced more energy than it took to start the reaction.

title: Word of the Day: prodigal
description: The word prodigal has appeared in 35 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Sept. 29 in the movie review Gods Creatures Review: A Crisis of Conscience by Natalia Winkelman:

title: Stephen Colbert Doesnt Want to Editorialize, but He Will
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: WEDNESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Crypto
description: What do you think this illustration is saying? How does it relate to or comment on society or current events? Can you relate to it personally? What is your opinion of its message?

title: 10 Years Later, a State Trooper Who Responded to Sandy Hook Looks Back
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  Bill Cario, who was among the first law enforcement officers to enter Sandy Hook Elementary School on Dec. 14, 2012, is adamant that a story about the 10th anniversary of the shooting that killed 20 first graders and six educators should not focus on him.

title: Covids Ripples, in the Middle of the Ocean
description: Two men, caught up in pandemic conspiracy theories and online misinformation, left their lives behind for what one of them called a great opportunity.

title: Britains Inflation Rate Dips From a Four-Decade High to 10.7 Percent
description: Britains inflation rate eased away from a 41-year high on Wednesday, but the slowdown brings only limited relief to a nation gripped by a deep cost-of-living crisis.

title: Two Dogs From North Korea Become Victims of a Political Squabble
description: SEOUL  President Yoon Suk Yeol of South Korea and his predecessor, Moon Jae-in, are both dog lovers. Still, they could not agree on how two dogs given to their country by North Korea should be cared for.

title: At Least 4 Dead as Boat Capsizes in English Channel
description: LONDON  At least four people died when a small boat capsized in the English Channel early on Wednesday, according to British officials, the latest in a series of tragedies in the waterway that have underscored the governments inability to cut off the route.

title: Newly Published, From Feminist Resistance to Ancient Empire
description: FRANCIS ROTHBART!: The Tale of a Fastidious Feral, by Thomas Woodruff. (Fantagraphics, $75.) Nearly a decade in the making, Woodruffs assured, hazy debut illustrated in feverish paintings and charcoal drawings  tells the story of a boy who is raised by foxes and magpies after losing his parents to jolts of lightning.

title: Did That Hit Arrive in 2022 or 1987? This Year, It Was Hard to Tell.
description: Songs with familiar samples dominated pop and performed well on the charts, lending upstart artists a trick to break through  and tossing older ones a lifeline.

title: What Were the Best and Worst Things About 2022 for You?
description: As the new year approaches and the retrospectives for 2022 roll out, we thought we would ask you for your own lists.

title: The Libertarian Party Became Too Extreme for Me, So I Changed My Political Allegiance
description: In her two years hosting The Argument, Jane Coaston has changed her mind about many things  from court packing to police reform (though not on whether we should contact alien life). But this year, she has changed her political party; once a proud card-carrying member of the Libertarian Party, Jane is now a registered independent. And she isnt alone: Kyrsten Sinema, former Democrat of Arizona, just became an independent, and we heard from many listeners of The Argument with their own experiences of why they switched their political party affiliations. Now wading in new political waters, Jane really wants to know: What happens when your party leaves you behind?

title: The Little Mermaid and Iron Man Join National Film Registry
description: Ariel is officially part of the human world.

title: Help! My Pricey Travel Credit Card Wouldnt Work When I Traveled
description: I have long been a business traveler, and therefore have the Chase Sapphire Reserve Card, touted to be one of the best travel cards out there, if you can stomach the high annual fee of $550. But on a trip earlier this year to Italy and the United Kingdom  my first and only significant travel in the past year  I tried to use the card every day for four days, and every time it was declined. Each time, I called Chase and spent hours speaking with various members of their team. They either claimed my card had been reset and should work again, punted me to someone else, disconnected me or hung up after being rude to me. I would like Chase to fix these problems and provide some recompense, such as some or all of my annual fee refunded. Can you help? Grace, Corona del Mar, Calif.

title: After a Frantic Year, Its Time for Slow Birding
description: The feeders are filled and hung; the scene is set. Are we ready to let our incessant daily to-do list take flight and settle in to watch the birds?

title: Can Anything Help a Hangover?
description: The quest to cure a hangover, or at least make it significantly less miserable, has eluded scientists and laypeople for years. But it hasnt stopped them from trying. Today, there is a growing assortment of products  from rebranded age-old remedies to new, specialized formulations  that claim to ease the morning-after symptoms. Alka Seltzer sells fizzing orange tablets designed for hangover relief. More Labss holiday drinking hack is to consume their liquid electrolyte supplement at night, so you never ruin your morning plans. You can even buy vitamin B1 patches to slap onto your skin or pills that blend aspirin and caffeine that promise to solve brutal hangovers in just 15 minutes.

title: Kyrsten Sinema Brings Bad Tidings for Democrats in 2024
description: Arizona was on the cusp of seating a Democratic governor alongside two Democratic senators for the first time since 1951 when Senator Kyrsten Sinema abruptly announced last week she is leaving the Democratic Party to become an independent.

title: In Congress, Party Switching Cuts Both Ways
description: WASHINGTON  When Phil Gramm, a conservative House member from Texas, left the Democratic Party in 1983, he immediately quit Congress and forced a special election that he won as a newly minted Republican six weeks later. He called his leave-and-start-from-scratch approach the only honorable course of action, since voters had elected him as a Democrat.

title: Its Happy Hour, Not Happy Every Hour
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location, or a request to remain anonymous. Letters may be edited.

title: The Federal Reserve signals more to come even as it slows rate increases.
description: Federal Reserve officials on Wednesday slowed their campaign to cool the economy but indicated that interest rates would rise higher in 2023 than previously expected as inflation proves more stubborn than policymakers had hoped.

title: Defenses Carved Into the Earth
description: Russia is building a vast network of trenches, traps and obstacles to slow Ukraines momentum. Will it work?
